dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A confined space, pitch black. Slowly, shapes and boundar emerge as a dim room, the size of a large freight elevato gradually comes into focus. A TEENAGE BOY is awakening. From his POV, through a_ grog haze...all around there are massive steel STORAGE DRUMS. slowly sits up, his vision still drifting... Suddenly, there’s an escalating, high-pitched hum and he notices a faint point of light at one edge of the ceiling He watches as the light grows, bisecting the space... Then, a violent lurch, and the vibrations stop. And, now, from above, he can hear the muffled cacophony of what sou like a CROWD, growing in volume.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: I’m down here! He's blinded as the ceiling gpens, and the space is absolutely flooded with light. Slowly, from the white-out, his vision returns. Revealing...DOZENS of YOUNG MEN staring back at him. They kneeling, crowded around the container he’s arrived in. S are barely teens, others seem to be in their early twenti The faces of many are streaked with mud, some bruised and cut. Not one is smiling. The TEENAGER’S focus darts back and forth as...

dialogues.speaker: HECKLER ONE
dialogues.text: Send him back!

dialogues.speaker: HECKLER TWO
dialogues.text: We’re gonna need a bigger graveyard! Laughter, even louder, as the world spins. Then...

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDING VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Enough! At once, the CROWD above pulls back out of view, quiet. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDING VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Go on and grab him. And then, two FIGURES suddenly hop over the edge of the container. The TEENAGER turns to see FIGURE ONE land behind him, and then back to FIGURE TWO, who’s coming toward him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 2. Their features are blurred -- just tall, menacing apparitions, who each grab him by an arm..

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Wait! .--and toss him up over the edge...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .»..onto the hard, dirt surface. Still the TEENAGER’S POV his stomach, as he slowly pushes up to scan the snickerin whispering CROWD.. They ‘re all wearing modified versions of the same strang uniform -- sleek gray tunics and slim trousers -- but man have cut-off their Sleeves, or their pants at the knee, a others adorned their chests with various scrawled decorations.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Where the hell am I? Then, the commanding voice, GALLY (21), steps forward. GALLY'S face is gaunt, something dark and unhinged just beneath the surface. His left eye clouded over, his right cold and piercing.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Get up, boy. This is no way to make a first impression. The TEENAGER tries to avoid GALLY’S menacing gaze, and lo past him, only to find an impossible sight in the near distance... A massive stone Wall rises 100-stories into the sky, defy the laws of physics. The TEENAGER looks back to GALLY, now frantic, as his vis again goes wobbly. His eyes roll back and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The TEENAGER’S eyes snap open. He’s now on his back, star at the ceiling of a rock cave. He tries to sit up, but can’t. His arms are tied down.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: (screams Please!! Help me!! His cry reverberates. A beat, then, from outside his cell the sound of footsteps.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 3. The TEENAGER strains to see again, and finds himself star through the bars at CLINT (17) -- nervous, bright eyes, angular features. CLINT turns down the corridor and shout to someone...

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: He’s awake! The TEENAGER is frantic as CLINT enters the cell and approaches...

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Just relax. You’1ll be out of here soon enough.

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: But why am I tied up?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: For your own safety. We never know how you Greenies are gonna react. beat) Now, lay back... GALLY enters, moving with a pronounced limp. The TEENAGER lurches up against his restraints...

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: Get these ropes off me! But GALLY says nothing, unmoved by the TEENAGER’S terror. From down the Hall there’s more commotion.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: He’s coming... Before the TEENAGER can ask who.... CLINT and GALLY move either side of the cell, standing erect, at attention. And, then, he enters... ALBY. Tall, charismatic. prailing ALBY, his Guards -- two muscular brutes, carryin hand-made cross-bows and wooden clubs, whose names we’1ll learn are NEWT (20) and ATLAS (18). CLINT keeps his eyes downcast, visibly nervous. GALLY, on the other hand, looks directly at ALBY, who pronounces...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Let’s get started. The TEENAGER quiets as ALBY approaches.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 4.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m Alby. A beat, close on the TEENAGER’S face. He’s actually straining to remember. Then it comes to him...

dialogues.speaker: TEENAGER
dialogues.text: I’m...I’m Thomas. ALBY pulls up a stool and sits.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Welcome to the Glade, Thomas. (to, Clint) Untie him. THOMAS’ eyes dart back-and-forth among the three men as C loosens his restraints...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: The Glade? Who the hell are you guys? Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Thomas, I look after everyone. As soon as we're done here, we’ll make sure you get settled. THOMAS, massaging his wrists, looks at ALBY, and relaxes moment in the presence of his authority.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Please...I just want to know what’s happening. ALBY nods, sympathetic.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: What’s the last thing you remember? THOMAS is about to answer, but when he opens his mouth, h speechless. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Besides your name, can you think of anything about yourself? Names of friends? Family? Again, THOMAS wants to answer, but struggles, drawing onl blank.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you have any idea where you live? The name of a city? The enormity begins to hit him...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do you_know what year it is, Thomas?  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 5. Breathless, beads of sweat forming, THOMAS’ heart is pounding.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Just like all the others. ALBY turns to him...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: That doesn’t mean we shouldn’t keep trying. Resigned, ALBY stands, suddenly, his demeanor hardened. H turns to CLINT again...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Frankly, pretty unimpressive.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: They’re shorthanded in the eastern fields. ALBY nods. Turns back to THOMAS one last time..

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: We have Laws here. Obey them. Work hard and you’1l be kept fed, alive, and reasonably comfortable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALLY now drags THOMAS from the dark corridors of the Pit a shallow cave complex -- into the bright afternoon light the Glade, a circular expanse the size of a large pit min

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (V.O)
dialogues.text: The Glade’s twenty acres of forest and farmland... There are primitive structures and large groves of trees block THOMAS’ view in several directions. But, everywhere looks those towering walls loom around the perimeter...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Surrounded by walls that touch the heavens. THOMAS notices that in each of the four cardinal directio the walls split open...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We call it the Maze. CRANE UP, DIRECTLY OVERHEAD...to reveal a spiraling labyr of twisting and turning passages” that unravel around the Glade forever into the distance.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 6.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Maze stands between us and home...whatever world exists outside this prison. As ALBY'S voice fades and we return to ground-level, THOM stares down his one clear sight-line where an entrance to Maze is visible a few hundred yards in the distance. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALLY takes THOMAS by the arm and pulls him toward a SHOR BOY waiting nearby, who goes pale as GALLY gets closer...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: You're the Field Hand? Chuck?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK .
dialogues.text: Um. That’s right, sir...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: (to Thomas ) Chuck will show you your trade, cover the rest of the basics. CHUCK tries to give THOMAS a reassuring look

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Chuck) After shift’s over, take him to the Homestead. *

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: This is ridiculous! You can’t just * put me to work! * Now, GALLY grabs THOMAS by the shirt and picks him up off ground.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: You'll do as you’re told. Or you! 11 learn quick what every man ere already knows: Do not make me angry. GALLY drops THOMAS, who's trying hard not to tremble.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Chuck) Now, get him out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS walks alongside CHUCK, who’s rushing down a clear through the trees, roughly the size of a two-lane highway On either side of the path, a series of walkways have bee hung, and, off in the distance, several haphazard structu appear to be suspended in the branches.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 7.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Pretty cool, huh? Most of it was already built when the first guys got here.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: How long have you --

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Long enough to tell you anything you’re wondering. Pegged me a Field Hand right from the start, just like you. But Clint gays another few months he might teach me to medic.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: And no one knows what’s happening?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: There were twenty guys at the beginning. Every week since for three years, the Box brings supplies. And every month, a new arrival like me and you. Just a name but no memory. THOMAS can hardly believe what he’s hearing...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: We must be from someplace.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Just follow my lead and stick with the program. Now, on their left, the trees begin to thin and THOMAS notices several strange FIGURES in the distance. They’re older, rail thin, and their clothes are in tatters. THOMAS slows, but CHUCK pulls him by the arm...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Changed Boys. Best to keep your distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS and CHUCK arrive at the Eastern Fields, where a do FIELD HANDS are working under the afternoon sun to empty same STORAGE DRUMS delivered earlier with THOMAS. The DRUMS are filled with water, and the FIELD HANDS are attaching hoses that empty them into a series of low-lyin irrigation ducts servicing the crops...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Brought back an extra set of hands.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 8. ZACK, a short, powerful boy, comes out from behind a near SHED, carrying a SHOVEL...

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Let’s hope you didn’t rub off on the walk over. (beat, to Thomas) What’s your name?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: I’m the boss man. Whatever Chuck here does, do the opposite. CHUCK hangs his head, embarrassed. ZACK hands CHUCK the SHOVEL.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Both of you head out to the spuds and start turning soil. As CHUCK starts to walk away, one FIELDHAND sticks out a and another shoves CHUCK, sending him crashing hard to th ground. THOMAS instinctively lunges forward...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Hey! The FIELDHANDS look at THOMAS, amused at his outburst. Ev CHUCK looks surprised as he struggles to his feet. THOMAS stands still, as ZACK now moves closer, eyeing him head-to-toe. But THOMAS just looks past ZACK, at that towering Wall, closer than ever. Suddenly, ZACK SUCKER-PUNCHES him in the stomach. THOMAS shakes off the blow as the others snicker. He slow lifts his eyes, and steps nose-to-nose with ZACK. ZACK winds up for a head-shot...but THOMAS catches his fi mid-swing, in a vice-grip. The other FIELDHANDS are shocked silent. THOMAS forces ZACK'S hand down, surprised by his own strength

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How ‘bout that... THOMAS releases ZACK and walks past him into the fields, CHUCK trailing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the shadow of the Wall, THOMAS, drenched in sweat, hea a shovel of dirt into a nearby pile. Out the corner of hi eye, he notices ZACK and some other FIELDHANDS in the distance, watching him. And then, a few feet away, CHUCK collapses, panting. THOM turns to him...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Follow your lead, huh? Laying on his back, CHUCK smiles...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I got this down to a science. Somewhere in the Glade, a bell clangs.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Especially the quitting part. All around, the other FIELDHANDS drop their tools and hea back toward the forest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS follows CHUCK and a stream of GLADERS down a woode path, finally emerging into a clearing... .--and stares, captivated, at one of the entrances to the Maze. He tries to push through the crowd, but before he c get close... MINHO (21) and ARON (20)... Both over six feet tall, not ounce of body fat on them, come bounding out of the Maze full sprint, and stop to catch their breath just inside t Glade. MINHO is wearing an armband, and they’re both carrying pa strapped to their shirtless backs, animal skin canteens, cross-bows, and razor-sharp spears. THOMAS stares at them, awestruck. CHUCK whispers...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: The Runners. They’re the strongest, the fastest. The gathered GLADERS move aside so the RUNNERS can pass, patting them on the back, offering to carry their gear, offering words of encouragement. +e HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 10.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They're looking for a way out of * the Maze. * THOMAS can’t take his eyes off them... *

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Why do they need weapons? * And then, suddenly a THUNDEROUS CLAP, as the Walls SLAM s closing off the Maze, as the last light of day vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A boisterous scene in the Glade’s central clearing, the * Homestead -- a large open space filled with wooden tables cook shed, a few fire circles, and what looks like a make shift playing field.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You want something to eat? The Glade cook, WINSTON, and his KITCHEN HANDS are handin out bowls of steaming chili to a long line of takers. The food looks good enough, but after what he’s just seen...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Not hungry. Everywhere THOMAS turns, small groups of GLADERS are talk loud: Yj Some are gathered around what looks like an arm- wrestling match, and others are kicking around a ball of vines and tree rubber. AS THOMAS takes in the rowdy atmosphere... CHUCK (0.S. Alby always says...Gotta keep up * our spirits. The guys know they * get caught moping, Newt and Atlas are gonna give ‘em a pep talk. A rough one.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I’m not so sure about your fearless leaders. (biting) How long they been stuck here? THOMAS glances up at the sky -- it’s a charcoal grey, wit few pinpoints of light. He studies it...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I guess the sky looks familiar. (beat) Sort of.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 11.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Took me a week before I stopped shaking. Just_had this terrible ache inside. Like there were family, friends...Who knows? People I was missing.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’m not sure what’s worse. I keep trying... But I feel nothing. Suddenly, a ball comes flying at them and THOMAS barely dodges it. There’s laughter from the playing field...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Chuck) This place blows, you know that? There’s not much CHUCK can say.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS walks into the surrounding Grove, past several GLA already bedding down for the night, who eye him warily. H finds an empty tree at the fringes. THOMAS collapses in the dirt, alone at last, his back aga the rough trunk. He can still see the fire circles burnin in the clearing and hear the laughter, shouts, and cries the other boys blowing off steam all around him. Then, from somewhere out in the Maze, a piercing SHRIEK c through the night, the menacing cry of some other-worldly creature. THOMAS‘ eyes water. But before a tear can fall, he wipes away with his sleeve, and buries his head, exhausted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS’ POV as he slowly awakens...Bright light, splinter through the tree branches, which gradually come into focu He sits up...to find CHUCK standing right in front of him

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You’re gonna miss the chow. Long day in the fields without it... THOMAS closes his eyes again.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Damn. It wasn’t a nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He pulls himself up, stiff and aching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clearing is buzzing with activity as the GLADERS prep for the day ahead of them. There’s a long line at WINSTON’s cook shed. As THOMAS and CHUCK take their place at the back of it, all eyes turn t MINHO entering the clearing, leading the RUNNERS. They ignore the line and WINSTON rushes to serve them. Then, t cook looks up...

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: A little respect Gladers? Let’s hear it! All the GLADERS begin clapping in unison, a tribute the RUNNERS barely acknowledge. Over the pounding noise...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: How do you become one? A Runner?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You don’t. Right out of the Box, they pull anyone with potential and make ‘em a Bagger. Like Newt and Atlas. Six months enforcing the Laws before they even give you a shot at it. MINHO and his men have finished collecting their rations suddenly, louder than the cheer, the blast of a loud, prolonged HORN..

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That must be a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What’s it mean?

dialogues.speaker: __ CHUCK
dialogues.text: The Box is rising...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From all over, GLADERS race toward the Box, a rectangular concrete bunker built into the earth, topped with steel doors. THOMAS follows CHUCK, who’s very excited...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I don’t get the big deal...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 13.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: It’s never come twice in a week. Never. CHUCK and THOMAS stop directly across the Box from ALBY, today, is also dressed like a RUNNER. He looks uneasy. Beside ALBY is GALLY, NEWT, ATLAS and a crew of BAGGERS. The ground vibrates, and there’s a high-pitched SCREECH a the elevator rises into place. Slowly, the ground splits, and the doors retract, opening... Everyone surges forward, angling for a better look. This time there are no massive storage drums...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: There! In the corner... Only a small FIGURE, curled up, face down. NEWT and ATLAS leap in. A quick beat and NEWT looks up...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: There’s something wrong... * NEWT turns over the FIGURE, trying to pick him up. Stops, frozen. *

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: I said get him up here! * ATLAS tosses the FIGURE to the surface. The GLADERS gasp. THOMAS sees... It’s a teenage GIRL, sprawled out helpless at ALBY’s feet shoulder-length hair obscuring her features, loose fittin clothes draped over her clearly feminine figure. THOMAS stares, captivated, from across the expanse of the open Box. Suddenly, the GIRL’S head turns toward him, revealing her face. THOMAS buckles over and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the view from the street of an ordinary brick Town Hou Through a gentle shower of white snowflakes, framed_in th second-story window is the silhouette of a LITTLE GIRL, h face obscured by shadows.... PRELAP...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thomas!  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 14. As we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: pei Seek trying to keep THOMAS from falling into the Box elow THOMAS struggles to stand, as several GLADERS stare at hi their attention drawn by the commotion. THOMAS, confused, reeling...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Still faint from yesterday... Across the Box, GALLY has noticed. THOMAS looks away. Meanwhile, the GLADERS are buzzing as ALBY and GALLY exam the GIRL at their feet, visibly unnerved by her presence. She has a tag affixed to her wrist. It reads: “She's the last one. Ever.” * GALLY looks ashen as ALBY removes the tag and conceals it long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Let us get a look at her! The GLADERS erupt and surge toward the GIRL. ALBY and GAL seem frozen, as NEWT tries to push back the mob...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Atlas! ATLAS unholsters his club, and several other BAGGERS help form a perimeter around the GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: ARI
dialogues.text: C’mon! We've all got a right! Finally ALBY snaps out of it. He holds up his RUNNER’S SP and erupts...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: The right to choke on my blade if you come one step closer! The GLADERS stop cold, shocked by the threat. GALLY is still crouching beside the GIRL, focused only on her, oblivious to the standoff. ALBY slowly composes himself. Lowers his weapon, almost embarrasse ALBY fCOnt’?) D) I'd trade my life for any Glader. Every man here knows that. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CROWD Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 15.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And right now this girl deserves the same protection. buzzes...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When she wakes up, we'll find out what she knows, if anything. * (to Gally) Take her to my quarters, under tuard, and make sure Clint has a ook at her. (to the Gladers) Today, I lead the Runners into the Maze. I expect a full day’s work from the rest of you! A brief beat before anyone moves, then...

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: Alright. You heard him. * The crowd disperses but THOMAS stands watching the GIRL a the BAGGERS unfold a stretcher. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pick slams violently into hard earth. THOMAS draws a de breath and swings once more into the long drainage ditch carving into the soil. *

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Where'd they take her?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Near the Map Room. There’s a path from the Homestead -- CHUCK stops himself...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait. Why? You’re not thinking...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I need to see her.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: It’s not allowed...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Allowed?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Gally will --  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 16.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Wake up Chuck! You do everything you're told and how’s that working out for you? CHUCK steps back, a bit wounded.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Some of them are jerks. I get that. But it’d be worse without the Laws.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Don’t talk to me about the Laws! They seem great for one thing: Givin Gally an excuse to be an asshole! THOMAS is really rattled... THOMAS (CONT’D) Something happened back there, and I can’t explain it.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: What? A beat, as THOMAS considers telling CHUCK what happened. Then, the bell clangs_indicating the Walls are about to b closing. The other FIELD HANDS lay down their equipment.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Maybe you should stay away from me. I don’t wanna get you in any more trouble. THOMAS drops his pick and follows the crowd...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..--back to the East Gate, where most of the GLADERS have gathered to await ALBY and the RUNNERS. But as THOMAS pushes through the crowd, he notices the mo is grim. The bolts have extended from the wall, and the s is once again darkening. He looks around and spots_all the RUNNERS, except one... MINHO. Also missing is ALBY. ARON and the others crouch, peering out into the Maze, waiting. GALLY stands back, calm, detached from the air o crisis. THOMAS notices that NEWT, ATLAS, and all the BAGGERS are present.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 17.

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: No way they’re just lost. Not Alby and Minho. (beat) If they’re not back now, it’s because they’re goners... One of the RUNNERS, ARON, looks to GALLY... What if we wanna take our chances? GALLY turns to NEWT...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: The Gate. Now. NEWT nods and the BAGGERS spring to action, deploying in line across the entrance to the Maze, blocking the RUNNER access. GALLY shows no emotion... GALLY eons D) Tomorrow the Glade has to keep functioning. From inside the Maze there’s a loud, piercing, human CRY.

dialogues.speaker: ARON
dialogues.text: That’s gotta be them. They must be right around the corner... ...and the RUNNERS surge forward.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Hold the line! The BAGGERS push back, and several begin to wrestle viole with the RUNNERS. Then, that horrific ear-splitting SHRIEK once again echoe Followed by...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just go! Forget me! At the sound of ALBY’s voice, ARON dips low and flips NEW over his back, making a dash for the Maze. But before he make it, GALLY floors him with a CLUB to the STOMACH. THOMAS turns to find CHUCK beside him...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (incredulous) They’re just gonna let them die out there?? THOMAS takes a step closer to the melee and time slows...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 18. He spots an opening as GALLY and ARON face-off, and walks toward the Glade’s exit. Now GALLY shouts at him...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Don’t move another inch! THOMAS pauses. Then, a whisper in his head...

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Run, Thomas... And THOMAS bolts, jeaping over GALLY and ARON, and racing into the Maze, just as the doors SLAM shut behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS immediately turns around, faces the closed Gate, absorbs what’s just happened. He can’t hear a thing from inside the Glade, or inside his head. It’s dead quiet. A beat, THOMAS swivels, back still against the Gate, and get our first real look at the Maze, ahead in the darknes A long, straight corridor, extending fifty yards in the distance. THOMAS admires the towering Walls on either sid of him. They’re covered in a thick mess of leafy vines. THOMAS takes a breath and moves a few steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Alby! Minho! His call reverberates, but there’s no answer. As THOMAS walks, he looks up and notices some of the vines hang acr the passage ahead, a web of growth, impossibly high above him. THOMAS reaches the end of the corridor, and a T-intersect In both directions, the passage turns out of sight after short distance. He stops. Then...the rustle of something moving cuts through the silence. THOMAS, frantic, looks both ways... Another murmur...growing louder. THOMAS is really panting He makes a choice and heads right, rounding the corner in another corridor which seems to extend indefinitely. Whatever is moving is now right behind him... He starts t run, stumbling, as he looks back over his shoulder. Now, he’s sprinting, the sound of his pounding heart and heavi breath drowning out everything. Then suddenly... He’s TACKLED...SLAMMED into the Wall, an pinned there. A hand’s over his mouth, and he’s staring e to-eye at MINHO.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Not a sound, you hear me?  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 19. THOMAS, stunned, manages to nod. MINHO removes his hand a backs slowly across the corridor to an opening THOMAS had noticed. MINHO ducks through the overgrowth, and THOMAS follows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...stepping into a circular chamber, thirty-feet in diame There are arched doorways leading off it in every directi Propped in one corner is ALBY, a massive gash on his forehead, torso hung forward, limp, unconscious.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Is he -- ?

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Cracked his skull. Out cold, but still breathing. You're the new kid, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: What the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: No one was going to help. I thought --

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: You did this on purpose? MINHO can’t believe it. MINHO (CONT’D Keep your mouth shut and do what I say. (beat, to himself) I need to think... From somewhere out in the Maze, another SHRIEK, the loude yet... MINHO thinks a beat, then throws ALBY over his shoulder. Without saying a word, he takes off through one the exits... THOMAS looks at all the identical doorways, considers his options. Decides to follow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS runs to catch up with MINHO who’s moving as fast a can down a corridor...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Let me help you with Alby....  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 20. MINHO ignores him...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: We're sitting ducks in the jungle...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What’s out there?

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: I told you to keep quiet. They approach another T-intersection. MINHO puts ALBY dow and covertly sneaks a glance in both directions. Then, from somewhere close, they hear that piercing SHRIE reverberating... MINHO (CONT’D) It’s like it has our scent or something... MINHO thinks and then looks down at ALBY. Makes a decision. MINHO (CONT’D) We leave him.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Chances are we’re all dead anyway. We split up, give The Griever three different targets.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: The Griever? THOMAS looks down at ALBY, helpless... THOMAS (CONT’D But, isn’t he your frien MINHO grabs THOMAS by the shirt, furious...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: His rules: Escape is all that matters! As MINHO moves to go, THOMAS sees the tangle of vines abo him. Has an idea...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Wait! But MINHO has already disappeared around the corner. THOM is alone, and for a moment all is quiet.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 21. THOMAS looks back toward the circular room, where they ca from. And then, another SHRIEK... THOMAS turns around to the Wall and starts tearing Vines away, frantic. THOMAS finds a thick Vine and pulls down, putting as much weight on it as possible. High above, somewhere in the darkness, it stays anchored. He grabs an adjacent Vine and now turns to ALBY, securing injured boy against his back. Then, he starts ¢limbing.:. THOMAS struggles with each inch, hand over hand, finding footholds in the stone behind the ivy. He’s only five fee off the ground, when, another SHRIEK, and...the “GRIEVER” seems to be getting closer. THOMAS scrambles faster...dragging ALBY on his back, high and higher. Until he SLIPS...sliding half the distance back to the floor...and comes face-to-face with...two RED, demonic ey peering out from the darkness. THOMAS, paralyzed, can barely make out the creature in th shadows. And, then... The GRIEVER’s entire body rolls into a BALL and catapults forward... Hanging on desperately, ALBY’s weight pulling him back, THOMAS now braces his feet against the Wall, and finds himself at an angle, like he’s repelling. The GRIEVER is closing... Holding onto the vine, THOMAS runs up the Wall...as the GRIEVER passes just underneath him. The GRIEVER uncoils, spins around and let’s out a blood- curdling SHRIEK... Another ten feet up, THOMAS looks down over his shoulder. and sees the GRIEVER slithering up the Wall straight towa him...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Great. THOMAS looks up again -- thinks about trying to outrun it then down, and sees the GRIEVER is already halfway to him THOMAS turns to ALBY, who’s limp body just dangles in the Vines. A beat, as THOMAS confronts what he’s about to do. He loo hard at ALBY...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 22.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (softly ) I tried. I’m sorry. Now THOMAS focuses back on the approaching GRIEVER. It’s feet away... five feet away... and its STINGER slowly unfolds... Just at it’s about to strike, THOMAS leaps off the Wall, simultaneous sliding down the Vine that he’s holding... He lands hard, rolling into the dirt, and slamming into t far Wall. He looks down at his hands, both chafed raw, an up at the GRIEVER. The GRIEVER has stopped, still clinging to the Wall, a fo below ALBY. Before it can react, THOMAS takes off running

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -..around the corner in the same direction MINHO followed but there’s no sign of him. THOMAS sprints, following the corridor’s serpentine path, turn after turn after turn, until...

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Thomas... He trips, stumbling to the ground...

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: When I wake up I won’t remember. THOMAS rises to a crouch, his eyes darting in every direction...

dialogues.speaker: GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We have to save them. Now, THOMAS is totally panicked, standing up, spinning in every direction...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What...the hell...is happening??? THOMAS stands still, and for a long moment, there’s silen THOMAS gets his bearings: He’s at the center of another T intersection. To his eft, fifty yards down, the passage ends in an arched doorway. To his right, fifty yards down is a solid wall with no outlet. Then, from behind him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 23.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Never stop moving! THOMAS, startled, turns to see MINHO jogging toward him..

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Did you hear that voice? * MINHO looks at him like he’s nuts...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Keep it together. * Suddenly, DUST kicks up all around them and the Wall ahea drifts sideways, taking the doorway with it... *

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (CONT/D)
dialogues.text: Pieces of the Maze shift every night! One of the reasons it’s been so hard to solve it... They turn to see the Wall at the far end of the corridor sliding. MINHO shouts over the now THUNDERING noise... MINHO (CONT’D) Stay! MINHO runs toward the dead end. He’s almost to it when... The GRIEVER careens into the middle of the corridor, separating THOMAS from MINHO. It SHRIEKS...looks both way then turns toward THOMAS. THOMAS stares at it, no place to run. MINHO looks back... MINHO (CONT’D) Holy sh--! But his cry is drowned out by the deafening rumble of the Walls’ movement. The GRIEVER curls up and takes off toward THOMAS...Who pa a beat, then sprints directly toward it... It’s a game of chicken as the distance closes. Then, just it looks like THOMAS might run head-on into the GRIEVER.. cuts to his left...and runs along the Wall, perpendicular the ground, until he’s past it... The GRIEVER spins to follow... * Ahead, MINHO is S*reveat wildly. The Wall at the once dea end has shifted to reveal a new doorway, but the opening fast sliding out of view... THOMAS sprints, the GRIEVER directly behind him... * Just as the GRIEVER is about to catch them, THOMAS and MI leap through the disappearing doorway...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 24.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-landing hard on an irregular, rocky surface. * A loud SHRIEK as the GRIEVER’S head is squeezed, and the comes off its tracks, coming to a stop. The pinned GRIEVER violently thrusts its STINGER at THOMA and MINHO, who scramble out of range. For a beat, they stare at its RED EYES, which seem to be studying them. “And then, the GRIEVER gathers all its strength and pulls back, disappearing into the darkness. Finally, it’s quiet. Both MINHO and THOMAS slowly peel themselves up. A long beat, as MINHO studies THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: That was a nice move back there. * THOMAS nods, numb with fear and exhaustion. He looks arou and sees they’re in an enclosed space the size of two football fields. It’s filled with black, volcanic BOULDER some piled high, others scattered alone like they were forgotten. MINHO notices THOMAS taking it in... MINHO (CONT’D) Chambers and corridors get bigger the farther out from the Glade you go.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: So, you know where we are?

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Roughly. We map this section pretty regularly. And then MINHO realizes... MINHO (CONT’D) But this room's always been closed off to us. THOMAS gestures back to the disabled Wall behind them...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Not anymore. *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINHO and THOMAS carefully traverse the blackened rocks, halfway toward the far wall.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Is it some kind of animal?  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 25.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Everyone’s got a theory. Another few steps, then MINHO stops dead. A round cloud of mist floats up and hangs in the air, swirling. And then, VROOM! it EXPLODES in a burst of FIRE, and THOM recoils from the rush of heat. MINHO (CONT’D) Just watch for the gas clouds. You have a couple seconds before they're ignited.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: How do you come out here every day? MINHO keeps walking. He’s spotted a small archway ahead, on the ground, but twenty feet up the Wall, like some kin window.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Now, that’s a first... MINHO leads THOMAS up a nearby hill of boulders, climbing they've reached the porthole. MINHO pulls himself up on t ledge and THOMAS comes up beside him. THOMAS’ POV... Below them is a long, narrow room unlike t other corridors of the Maze. Every surface is smooth and polished.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What’s down there?

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: No idea. Never seen anything-- And, then in the darkness, the GRIEVER slithers directly below them. THOMAS and MINHO hold their breath, but the creature keeps moving disappearing at the other end of th passage. THOMAS and MINHO slowly exhale.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: That lead to another part of the Maze? MINHO starts climbing down...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: We'll check it out tomorrow. Right now, it looks like we pulled offa miracle. It’s almost morning... THOMAS takes one last look at the strange corridor and tu to follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sky above the Maze has begun to glow with the early l of dawn. THOMAS and MINHO come jogging down the corridor where THOMAS left ALBY, fruitlessly scanning the Vines ab them. They're about to give up when...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: There! MINHO looks to where THOMAS is pointing. ALBY’S foot is barely visible through the vegetation. But it’s still.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: At least it didn’t drag away his body. Then, from above...

dialogues.speaker: ___ ALBY
dialogues.text: (faint) Min... MINHO looks at THOMAS. He can’t believe it.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Alby! And MINHO starts climbing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Wall’s bolts retract, and they slowly split open, revealing... ALBY draped between MINHO and THOMAS, his gash still oozi barely conscious. GALLY is waiting just inside the Glade, along with NEWT, ATLAS, CLINT and the other RUNNERS.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: I don’t believe it... The RUNNERS rush to help carry ALBY. They lay ALBY down and gather around. CLINT approaches carrying a strange CRYSTAL TUBE...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: He’s not stung. You can put away the Serum. CLINT nods and slides the tube back into his satchel. He kneels and examines ALBY...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 27.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: The cut’s not as bad as it looks, but we gotta get him to a bed...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: (to Aron) You heard him! ARON, still steaming from the altercation the night befor makes a point of first looking to MINHO, who nods his ass Only then do the RUNNERS begin loading ALBY onto a stretc

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: When he’s settled, regroup in the Map Room. As the RUNNERS lift ALBY and begin carrying him off, CLIN passes THOMAS who stands dazed, unsure what to do.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: Incredible. A night in the Maze. And a Field Hand’s one of the first to survive it... THOMAS tries to smile, appreciative. And then... GALLY signals NEWT, who roughly grabs THOMAS by the arm..

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Hey! ...drawing MINHO’s attention...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: What are you doing? GALLY starts limping away, no interest in arguing.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: He violated the Laws and entered the Maze. (to Thomas) You're going to the Pit until we decide what to do with you. MINHO can’t believe it...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: After what happened out there? He saved Alby’s life! GALLY stops to face MINHO...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: I'm calling the shots right now. And the Laws will be enforced. For all we know, he made it worse, angered the Griever...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 28.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: When Alby hears...he’ll never allow this! GALLY explodes...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Alby’s got much bigger problems! beat) The girl’s the beginning of something. And the Greenie... You're all too arrogant to see what’s happening! MINHO grabs GALLY and pulls him close...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: I remember what you did in the First Days. Alby and I may be the only one’s left who do. But that was a long time ago. And I’m starting to think the guys are right. “You belong in an asylum. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Please! Both of you! GALLY and MINHO turn to him. A beat, then, THOMAS looks a GALLY...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You don’t trust me for some reason. Fine. (beat) Then I assume you won't care if I die looking for a way out of here. To MINHO...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want to be a Runner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cell door slams shut on THOMAS. He watches as NEWT disappears down the corridor, then looks around at_the ot empty cells ringing this small cavern deep in the Pit. At the very back of the room, THOMAS notices an enclosure that looks different. Behind two layers of extra-thick fencing, stacked side-by-side... More of those CRYSTAL TUBES CLINT was carrying. THOMAS stares at the crystal, and for a brief moment, as candlelight falls at the right angle, he catches a glimps his own fractured reflection.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 29. He shifts position, trying t to © recapture his first dis look at his own face, when.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (whispers ) Hey...Brought you some dinner. CHUCK stands with a plate of food and a canteen of water. THOMAS backs away from the bars.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: How’d you get in here?

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Told the guard I screwed up and drew clean-up duty. (beat, with a smile) He believéd me. THOMAS also smiles. CHUCK slides the food through the bar and sits down in the hallway. As THOMAS digs in, starving

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Thanks. Those things I said, yesterday --

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You were blowing off steam. That’s what friends aré for, isn’t it? (beat) And the girl’s still in some kind of coma. In case you were wondering. All is forgiven. THOMAS absorbs this and then nods, appreciative. THOMAS eats some more, but CHUCK can "hardl contain himself.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So? What was it like? From the day I got here, all I’ve been hearing about is the Maze. I can’t believe you've been inside it... For the first time, THOMAS really reflects...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I wouldn't have made it without Minho. But the funny thing was...It all felt familiar. beat I thine 3F) pelong out there somehow.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: No one belongs out there. That’s ridiculous. THOMAS thinks a moment.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What if we’re here because we did something terrible?  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 30.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: What could we have done to get this kind of punishment? CHUCK bows his head, clearly upset by the suggestion and THOMAS immediately regrets it. Upbeat now...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What do you imagine Chuck? When you think of home? CHUCK doesn’t look up... CHUCK | . It’s so hard to picture anything. I guess...a Mom and Dad who order

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: me around. Tell me to clean up, take a bath, eat my supper. (beat) You know... Just two people who love me... CHUCK’s voice breaks and THOMAS reaches through the bars, squeezing his arm in comfort.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Chuck, last night, I think we found something. Important. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS steps out of the Pit into the morning light, squin as his eyes adjust. MINHO is waiting.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Guard told me I could go...What happened?

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Alby wants you.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: EXT. ALBY’S DWELLING A large multi-room structure, woven through the branches the Glade’s largest Banyan. It stands alone, in a separat clearing, north of the Homestead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 31. INT. HALLWAY - ALBY’S DWELLING THOMAS follows MINHO down a long hallway inside ALBY’S dwelling. He passes a closed door, and feels compelled to stop outs it. MINHO is a few steps ahead, and THOMAS checks to see no o else is watching. He pushes the door slightly open... ..-.-and finds THERESA in bed, still unconscious. THOMAS stands frozen, and then SUDDENLY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .»..once again, that little BOY staring at the silhouette the LITTLE GIRL in that second-story window. One of the falling white flakes catches in the BOY’s eye. wipes it away, leaving a black streak across his cheek. I not snow. It’s ash. And then suddenly, the GIRL is pulled out of view. An old WOMAN, her mother, looks down at the BOY with a stern gla and the BOY takes off running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-arriving, out of breath, in a small kitchen which appe to have been ransacked. His FATHER is frantically stuffin CANNED FOOD and aluminum wrapped ENERGY BARS into a suitc thrown open on the dining table. He looks up...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Where the hell have you been?!

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: I wanted to say goodbye... A beat, as his FATHER looks furious, about to explode. Instead, he pulls the BOY close and smothers him in a hug

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: You'll see each other again. They're taking all the kids from the neighborhood to the same Camp. +e HF *

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: + eH  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 32.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: And, we're all coming home in a few months anyway, right? The FATHER looks at the BOY, profound sadness in his eyes

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Right. Just in time for soccer.

dialogues.speaker: FLASH BACK TO
dialogues.text: THOMAS. His heart now pounding. He has no idea how many seconds have passed during his vision, but MINHO is now a the other end of the Hallway. THOMAS closes the door as MINHO barks...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: C’mon! Don't keep him waiting. INT. STUDY - ALBY’S DWELLING ALBY’S stands at his window, his head bandaged, looking o over the Glade. He turns to face THOMAS, and it’s immediately clear he has no plans to say thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: What did I tell you? THOMAS doesn’t know how to reply...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We have laws here. (beat) But you chose to ignore them.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I was trying to help... ALBY studies THOMAS.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: As much as Gally would like, we can’t keep you locked up forever. And with all that’s going on, the last thing I need is you loose in the Glade looking for trouble. THOMAS turns to MINHO...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e HF

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 33.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: You showed promise out there. Good instincts. But right now, you’re still a liability.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Does this mean--?

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: You’re a Maze Runner, Thomas. (beat) Don’t make me regret this. Off THOMAS face, both nervous and excited...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the Gear Locker -- a small equipment shed -- where MIN hands THOMAS a spear...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: For self-defense only. If you have to use it, you’re probably a dead man anyway. «..canteen...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (CONT/D)
dialogues.text: Runners get extra rations of water, so no excuse for dehydration... .+-and a lump of charcoal, which THOMAS eyes skeptically.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Trust me. MINHO keeps moving..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -+-to the Map Room, a large cabin lined with cubby holes around the periphery. Each cubby is overflowing with roll scrolls of parchment. MINHO grabs one and unrolls it on t large center table.. It's a map of the Maze...a massive circle that surrounds Glade, led in with a mess of lines, dashes, and unexplore blank spaces.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: We‘ve been looking for a way out since we got here. (beat) As you've seen, first ring of the Maze is Jungle. Glade’s surrounded by it. + eH + eH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 34. As MINHO continues..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS, now in his full RUNNER’S gear, races after MINHO a long’ Jungle corridor...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Took us a few weeks to find the right path, but we discovered that’s only a warm-up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-into an even wider passage of shimmering sand...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: North of the Jungle is the desert. Like running through an oven. THOMAS stumbles, dripping in sweat and MINHO pauses.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Sand radiates heat somehow. MINHO pours a drop of water on the ground and it STEAMS. MINHO (CONT ’ D Whatever you do, don’t fall. Shoes have protective soles, but if you stand still for too long, they’1l burn also. THOMAS looks down and lifts up his feet, instinctively. T follows MINHO, who takes off running...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...through thick grass that towers above him...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Thought we caught a break when we found a way East to The Grasslands... (beat) But hidden among the harmless stalks are these lovely bushes. MINHO has stopped beside a low-growing PLANT that looks l a THORN BUSH.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Ouch.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Ouch ain’t the half of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: es  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 35. MINHO prods the BUSH with his SPEAR and the entire plant SNAPS closed like a BEAR TRAP.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’1l watch where I step. MINHO nods and pushes ahead through the grass...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-into seemingly empty corridors of flat, smooth stone.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Kept pressing clockwise and found this playground... MINHO lets loose... leaping and bouncing between the bare surfaces...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Easy to run... THOMAS tries a back-flip off the Walls. -nearly crashing MINHO, who steps out of the way, placing one foot on a darkened patch of ground...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Except where the floor falls out from under you. ..-which PLUMMETS into a bottomless OBLIVION. THOMAS peaks over the edge... MINHO (CONT’D) Breakaway sections are a shade darker. MINHO and THOMAS step around the hole, and start running again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .+-into a long corridor full of Boulders.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And, finally, in the West, as you know, the Boulders. As a FLAME BURST ignites in front of them, MINHO cuts int intersecting hallway, and stops. THOMAS comes up behind h hunched over and heaving. MINHO smiles. Takes out his charcoal, and puts an “X” nex to the door they just came through...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy)

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Use your charcoal to mark your route. Like bread crumbs. As THOMAS struggles for breath...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have a seat. THOMAS collapses to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: It goes on forever..

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Once_we realized it was a bi circle, we've focused on moving out from the Glade as far as possible. But we’ve hit a dead-end in almost every direction. (beat) Of course with the Walls moving, the Maze looks a little different every day. For all we know, the route to go farther just hasn’t opened up yet. THOMAS shakes his head...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Not that we’d notice...At this pace it’s all a blur.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: No choice. The Griever’s most active at night. But even in daylight, it’1l hunt down us if we don’t keép moving. (beat) And that’s why we memorize what we see and record it in on the maps. So we can look for new paths we might have missed while we were out ere. THOMAS takes a long sip of water.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: So what now?

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: The other guys are pushing ahead in the Grasslands. It’s the one section where we haven’t hit an outer limit. But you and I... THOMAS gets up... __ THOMAS ; Are going to follow the Griever.

dialogues.speaker: OE
dialogues.text: ee  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 37. MINHO smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS trails MINHO toward the opening left by the disabl Wall. They crouch through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: sigomerging in the large Boulder Room, and head toward th elevated archway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the top of the boulder pile MINHO pauses and turns to THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: We’‘re here to see where this leads. But first sign of the beast, we back out. Got it? THOMAS nods. MINHO removes his backpack and takes out a l rope, anchoring it in the rocks. He throws it through the archway. EXT. GRIEVER’S EXIT CORRIDOR - THE MAZE THOMAS and MINHO lower themselves into the Tong, narrow corridor. At one end, they notice a seam in the floor...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: This must be how it accesses the Maze. Ground opens in here and Somewhere on the other side of that wa But THOMAS is focused on the opposite end of the passage.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: That way... That’s where it was heading... MINHO and THOMAS 223 to the end of the corridor...and the entrance to some kind of tunnel. They stop, peering into the darkness. Before MINHO can object, THOMAS starts walking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -..through pitch black, holding onto the curved Walls for balance, until he can see light creeping into the tunnel ahead of him. THOMAS calls back...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy)

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: C'mon! It opens up! .--and starts moving faster... Behind him, MINHO is making his way forward...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hold on! 38. And then, MINHO’s POV... THOMAS silhouetted in the round, bright opening of the Tunnel’s exit. THOMAS pauses a beat...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Wow... And steps out into the light. INT. STUDY - ALBY’S DWELLING

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: ALBY sits behind a massive desk carved out of a tree trun He’s studying several maps of the Maze, and fingering the note that arrived with THERESA. GALLY comes to the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Alby -- But he’s cut short...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: How many years have we been at this? GALLY senses ALBY is lost in his own head...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Too many.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Some of these kids... They were children when they came out of the Box. I told them the Maze was the way home. I told them to trust me. (beat) I’m losing them. I can sense it.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: A real man has the courage to change course. It’s not too late. But it will be. Not the response ALBY was looking for. He snaps out of hi reverie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 39.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: What do you want, Gally? A long beat, as the old friends study each other.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: The girl seems to be waking up. And she’s mumbling a name... ALBY waits, on edge...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Thomas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS stands in the dusty alcove of a magnificent slot canyon, the smooth, undulating walls rising high above hi Passages snake off in every direction, bounded by twistin light tan walls. THOMAS takes it in, as MINHO emerges from the tunnel behi him, also captivated.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: This is no better than the rest of the Maze. These canyons could take months to navigate... There are six different chasms heading off in different directions... MINHO (CONT’D) I guess we work ‘em left to right. But THOMAS is staring at the ground and headed for one of passages in the center...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Do you see this?

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: What? There are light streaks on the ground, barely visible, le by something slithering across the soft, talc-like surfac

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Bread crumbs. Griever style...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS and MINHO follow the trail in the sand left by the Griever...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 40. Jogging through the snaking passage, they pass under a massive rock overhang... Leap up onto a series of rises... Slide sideways through a narrow bottleneck...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .--and finally emerge in front of a massive Cavern. THOMAS and MINHO slow down and cautiously approach the op rock face in front of them. As they walk closer, a faint HUM grounds louder... MINHO brandishes his spear. THOMAS does also... Then, across the bottom lip of the Cavern, two RED EYES emerge from the darkness. The GRIEVER. MINHO starts backing away...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: End of the road, Thomas. And then... another set of RED EYES appears, FOUR total.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What the--? And... TWO GRIEVERS slither forward, barely visible in th shadows. They pulsate, ten feet in front of MINHO and THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you know it had a brother? MINHO shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Well, that’s bad news then. THOMAS thinks a_beat, then hurls his spear like a javelin It bounces harmlessly off the first GRIEVER.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Really? THOMAS shrugs: “Worth a try?” He and MINHO take off running... Back through the bottleneck... which the GRIEVERS squeeze through effortlessly... Vaulting back down the rises...At the bottom looking back see the two GRIEVERS, a DARK BLUR, ROLLING after them...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 41. And taking the corners of the snaking passage by kicking the Walls, parkour-style...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally, they dive into the Tunnel, scrambling through th dark, when they hear the SHRIEK of their pursuers in unis As the terrible sound overcomes them, THOMAS and MINHO co their ears, stumble to a halt, frozen in terror. Then THO glances back...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (incredulous ) They’re stopping... At the threshold of the Tunnel, the GRIEVERS sit, their STINGERS extending and retracting in what seems like a warning. MINHO takes a breath. Looks at THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: You get the message? He doesn’t. MINHO (CONT’D) Those canyons belong to them. Off- limits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINHO and THOMAS jog back toward the Glade, the late afternoon sun fading. As they approach the Gate, they see NEWT, waiting. INT. HALLWAY - ALBY’S DWELLING MINHO and THOMAS, still in their Runner’s gear, now follo NEWT through ALBY’s Dwelling...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: There must be some mistake...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: (sarcastic) Yeah. She meant the other Thomas. NEWT stops at the bedroom door and gestures for them to enter.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 42. INT. BEDROOM - ALBY’S DWELLING - CONTINUOUS The GIRL, her face streaked with tears, is sitting up ina cot. GALLY stands against the wall, ALBY is beside her

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Meet Theresa... THOMAS is transfixed as THERESA turns to the doorway slow still groggy : Her eyes are slightly downcast as her gaze settles on him, and THOMAS is drawn into her sad visage. a beat, they are the only two people in the room. But GALLY is eager..

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: You recognize him?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I don’t know why, but... It’s the VOICE THOMAS has been hearing in his head... THERESA (CONT’D) How do I know you? THOMAS hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: I--
dialogues.text: The stares intensify. ALBY. GALLY. MINHO. And THOMAS makes a decision...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have no idea who she is. (beat) Nothing about her is familiar. For a beat, his denial hangs there. THERESA seems hurt, confused...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: That can’t be true. (beat) I’m sure... THOMAS ignores her, looks pleadingly to the other men...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I swear! My mind’s a blank slate, just like the rest of you. Then harshly, back to THERESA...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why are you doing this? THERESA leans forward, growing in anger...  43.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I just woke Up alone, surrounded b: guys in some kind of nightmare wit no memory... Your name is the_only thing in my head! I can’t help that! ALBY eases her back on the pillows...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Calm down, please. I know this is overwhelming. GALLY steps forward...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: I say the Greenie’s lying. He’s been hiding something from the beginning! We need to lock him back up until we get to the bottom of this! THOMAS is about to defend himself, when...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: That’s enough! ALBY glares at GALLY, then turns to THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Thomas ) This can’t be a coincidence. You need to think long and hard how it’s possible. eat, to Theresa) Both of you. GALLY, enraged, storms out of the room. A beat, as the others watch him go, and ALBY and MINHO sh a concerned look. Then...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: I’ve got more bad news. (beat) The Griever...it’s not alone out there. There are two of them. ALBY’S eyes go wide, but before he can respond, NEWT come the door. He sneaks a curious glance at THERESA, who look away embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Zack and some of the guys are heading this way. They've heard the girl’s awake. THERESA looks to ALBY, frightened. He assures her...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 44,

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: You're perfectly safe here. I promise. Get some rest, and we'll talk more tomorrow. ALBY gets up and approaches NEWT.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take Atlas and the other Baggers to head them off. Anyone steps foot in my clearing, beat them unconscious. ALBY walks out, brushing past THOMAS. THERESA looks at THOMAS again, her expression pleading. A beat, then he turns his back and walks out on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS walks through the trees with CHUCK, who’s updating on the latest gossip...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Everyone’s saying she asked for you by name! How’s that possible? THOMAS shakes his head, disgusted...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: It's not. (beat) These guys really have nothing better to do than spread rumors? CHUCK tries to assure him now...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. They’re all just jealous. (beat) So, are you gonna paint me a picture of this girl?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: She's pretty. I already said she was pretty.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: That’s not real specific. First real woman -- ever! Did you get close enough to touch her’ Suddenly, THOMAS and then CHUCK stops in his tracks. Haun eyes peer out from the shadows all around them. They’re surrounded by the CHANGED BOYS. THOMAS whispers to CHUCK...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 45.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Now you wanna tell me what’s wrong with these guys? CHUCK stammers...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: They were all stung by the Griever. Serum saved their life, but... THOMAS looks at him...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: They say it’s like your insides are melting. For hours. Three of the CHANGED BOYS step forward, circling THOMAS.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Go back to the Homestead, Chuck. CHUCK hesitates. THOMAS puts on a brave face...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I'll be fine. Remember, I’m the guy who survived the Griever. CHUCK reluctantly assents and takes off toward safety. EXT. GALLY’S GROVE - NIGHT The CHANGED BOYS march THOMAS through a dark empty field an isolated corner of the Glade. There’s a dense Grove ahead, in front of which lies a massive overturned tree, rotting away slowly... The CHANGED BOYS shove THOMAS through the tangle of roots EXT. GALLY’S CLEARING - CONTINUOUS .--into an open clearing that backs against the Glade’s northern Wall...where it looks like someone’s been prepar for Armageddon. GALLY stands before a series of defensive fortifications angled spikes pointing out of shallow ditches -- laid out concentric circles around a_ round yurt-like structure, b against the base of the Wall.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Like what I’ve done with the place? THOMAS watches the CHANGED BOYS walk past GALLY through t armaments and disappear into the shelter.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 46.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You live here with them? (beat ) I guess insanity’s contagious...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Clarity is, Greenie. (beat) But whatever you call it, I picked it up the old fashioned way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat, as THOMAS realizes.. *

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Griever nearly took off my leg, the wound was so deep. I was the third man to drink the Serum. * (beat) * I assumed I'd wind up like the rest. Shattered. Mute. Unable to do anything but wander aimlessly with the animals. (beat) I still don’t know why I’m different. THOMAS gathers himself...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Congratulations on being only half a freak. (beat) I still don’t know what you want from me...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: I saw things during the Changing. Things I can’t forget. GALLY steps toward THOMAS, now frozen...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alby said they were fantasies. Hallucinations that would only distract us. And to be fair, they were only splintered fragments... beat But, I believed they were memories. And, now, I’m sure of it. Because you were there. THOMAS’ blood goes cold as he considers whether GALLY cou be telling the truth. A pause, then... GALLY (CONT ’D) But you weren’t suffering like the rest of us. You were different, Thomas. THOMAS erupts...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 47.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’m done-- But GALLY suddenly grabs THOMAS by both shoulders with an unexpected strength and ferocity. A madness, brews just beneath the surface...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: I won’t allow you to cause more harm than you have already. The Glade may be imperfect, but it’s our only refuge. And your stunts are threatening all of us! (beat) You can deny it_all you want, but you and the girl are connected. And you’re here to betray us.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. BEDROOM - ALBY’S DWELLING - THE NEXT MORNING Light streams into the bedroom where THERESA slowly awake She looks around, gets her bearings, and slides her legs the cot, sitting up slowly. THERESA sees the door is closed, and she walks to the roo one window. THERESA’S POV...her first look at the Glade: the small, e clearing around ALBY’S dwelling. Two brutish BAGGERS, the back to her, are idly on guard. THERESA’s lip begins to tremble, and it looks like she mi cry again, when...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Feeling better? THERESA gathers herself, before turning around, her arms crossed, defensive.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: How long do you plan to keep me here?

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: If you mean the Glade, you’re no more trapped than the rest of us. As for this room, that’s why I’m here... To invite you to breakfast. ALBY smiles warmly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS and MINHO run alongside each other...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 48.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Are we really not gonna talk about this?

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Talk about what?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What the girl said.. MINHO doesn’t even look at him. Sincere but abrupt...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: You don’t know her. I believe you.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: And Gally? MINHO ignores him. THOMAS (cont: D) The guy’s nuts... Why does Alby even put up with him? MINHO stops abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Alb would be dead if it wasn’t for Ga (beat) We all would. Gally was the first man brave enough to come out here. And before he got stung, he taught me everything I know about the Maze. Everything. THOMAS studies the guilt and sadness on MINHO’s face. But before THOMAS can say anything, MINHO suddenly takes off again. THOMAS sighs, frustrated, and sprints to keep up with him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBY, playing proud tour guide, leads THERESA through the Homestead Clearing. They’re trailed closely by NEWT, on guard for them.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: As you can see, it’s a simple arrangement, everyone doing their part to keep the place functioning. THERESA looks around, taking it all in, and trying to avo eye-contact with the few passing GLADERS who stop to gawk her.  49.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Keeping this many guys under control? I wouldn’t call that simple... ALBY laughs.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Well, the early days weren’t tty. Pre (beat) We were constantly fighting over the water, could Ka aly manage to harvest the crops that were growing. ALBY’s genuinely upset as he remembers...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Third month, I’m walking near the West Gate and see this tiny figure near the bushes. It’s this kid, Joshua. Couldn’t have been older than twelve. His neck was broken. Killed in a brawl between two groups of guys over a soft spot to bed down on. THERESA blanches...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So, I got organized, put an_end to the nonsense. Ever since, I’ve kept everyone focused on one thing... Finding a way out of here. THERESA considers ALBY with a new warmth in her eyes, dra to him...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: And now I show up... (beat) One big distraction. Before ALBY can reassure her, she reaches out, putting a on his arm. THERESA (CONT’D) Thank you for helping me. ALBY nearly blushes. A charged beat, before she breaks contact. THERESA thinks a moment. Then... THERESA (CONT’D Not sure how much use I'll be in the fields but you said there are maps of this Maze? ALBY nods...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 50. THERESA (CONT’D) Fresh set of eyes couldn’t hurt, could it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALBY holds open the door to the Map Room, and THERESA ent He walks to a cubby and pulls out three rolls, unfurling side-by-side on the center table.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: These are all different sections of the Maze, on the same da We line them up, look for new paths between them, any route that might get us closer to the outside edge and hopefully an exit... THERESA is fascinated by the images before her, running h fingers along the lines’ on the page, like they’re someho familiar.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You mind if I stay here for a while?

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: I've studied these for years. I promise I haven’t missed anything. THERESA finally looks up...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I didn’t mean that... But this seems like a safe place to hide out. beat) Besides, who knows what else is rattling around my head besides the name of a boy who’s never met me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS and MINHO have stopped for a quick water break ins a grassy corridor. They are mid-argument...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’m telling you we should go back to the cave. There could be something inside there!

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Yeah, I’m guessing two giant predators with poisonous stingers. beat) We’‘re looking for an exit, not new ways to die. MINHO closes his canteen, the discussion finished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINHO (CONT’D) C’mon. For all we know, the way out’s right around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERESA stands at the center table, which is now crowded parchment scrolls spread all over. She runs her hand thro er hair, and sits back on a stool, overwhelmed. ALBY knocks and enters...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Ready to give up? THERESA smiles... A breeze blows through the open door and sends some of th maps floating off the table.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I’m so sorry... THERESA kneels to collect them and ALBY rushes over to he her...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. They’re all labeled... But THERESA has stopped gotiecting them. The one parchmen she’s holding is caught in the late afternoon sunlight, rendering it nearly translucent. THERESA stands up slowly, lost in thought. She lays the parchment on top of another map on the table. Some of the ines match in both versions, forming thicker sections whe the two maps are held together. THERESA concentrates intensely. ALBY rises beside her...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Are you remembering something else?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Not exactly... Then, there’s another knock. It’s NEWT...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: We have a problem. The Box rose, this time on schedule.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: It’s completely empty. No storage drums. Nothing.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 52. ALBY considers this.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: How long can we last?

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Before we die of thirst, or before there’s a rebellion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A growing mob of GLADERS are gathered around WINSTON’S Co Shed, shouting and jeering. ZACK is at the center... ZACK ; Unlock the shed or my guys will bust it apart! WINSTON’s resolve is foundering, and the two BAGGERS at h side look ready to cut and run...

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: C’mon Zack...Alby’s gonna know what to do...

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: He’s led us down a dead end! Time to wake-up Win! We gotta fend for ourselves... The MOB roars in agreement...

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: Whaddaya want with it anyway?

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: I’ve got a spare tank in the fields and I have my guys shutting down all the aqueducts. (beat) We gotta right to know where we stand. All of us. WINSTON looks ready to relent, when...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: There’s less than a quarter tank in the cook shed. The MOB turns to see ALBY, NEWT and ATLAS.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which is why I’ve kept a reserve. A brief wave of relief move through the crowd. Then...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 53.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That, plus what’s left in the fields will last us another few weeks. A month if we're lucky. The MOB takes this like a punch in the gut.

dialogues.speaker: ZACK
dialogues.text: So that’s where all your Laws led us...Starved like dogs! THOMAS and MINHO now come upon the edge of the gathering, the MOB grows louder...

dialogues.speaker: ZACK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You've been lying to us from the start! MINHO moves closer to the action. THOMAS is about follow when... GALLY steps out of the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: It’s not his fault! (beat) Not yet, anyway. ALBY giares, ready to unleash the line of BAGGERS massing behind him.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (CONT'D)
