dialogues.text: We're all victims here. Victims of the traitors sent to destroy us! THOMAS is still on the fringe of the crowd. He sees where this is headed and backs out of the clearing, unnoticed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS jogs up to the Map Room, where one BAGGER stands b the door, anxious.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: They need you at the Homestead.

dialogues.speaker: BAGGER
dialogues.text: But... Alby said to watch the girl--

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’1l watch her. The BAGGER looks at THOMAS, still in his Runner’s gear...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You ever want to carry a spear out there, get moving! There’s about to be a riot! The BAGGER hesitates, and then takes off running...  54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERESA has put together several stacks of maps on the central table. She looks up, startled to see THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You.. She starts backing away...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Please. We need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Where’s the guard? Alby said --

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Theresa... I’m sorry. THERESA stops retreating but is still skeptical...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not sure how... But you were right. (beat) I do know you. His admission sinks in for both of them. THERESA waits fo him to elaborate...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When they pulled you out of the Box...I realized right awa In fact, I had some kind of f ash. (beat) I might have seen where we come from. THERESA can’t believe what she’s hearing...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: What? Where??? THOMAS finally wants to get it all out...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (rambling) It’s not that simple. We were just little kids, but I think I saw your mother. And my father. Something was wrong and we were going away...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You’re not making any sense...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I know. None of it does. And before you woke up. I heard your voice in my head. It’s like our minds are connected!  His rambling only makes her confused, angry...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Our minds... Like telepathy? beat that!e eSnpossible. I don’t remember anything... He’s stopped. And then she realizes...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Yesterday, why didn’t you just say something???

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: We can’t tell them yet. It’s too dangerous. Now, she’s really shocked.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Dangerous??

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: We don’t even know what it means... They ve been here three years and not. ing changes. Then, we show up and it’s all falling apart! 55. THOMAS stops, takes a breath. Takes a few steps closer to THERESA. With a softer tone...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There’s a guy outside right now, Gally, trying to convince them it’s our fault there’s no more water. That we’re the reason their world is crumbling around them. This gets THERESA’s attention. Slowly realizing THOMAS’ may be justified...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: We need to do something...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: That's why I’m here... To see if we can o disc out what’s happening. If we discover anything useful, I promise we’ll come clean. But until then, we have to keep quiet.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You mean lie.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: If we need to, yes. (beat) If they think we're a threat, if they turn on us... fear  56.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Alby will protect us. He’s taken care of me.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Alby may seem like a good guy but 1 do whatever it takes to keep a lid on this place. THERESA considers this.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please, you have to trust me. A long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: So, how do we do this? THOMAS breathes a sigh of grateful relief.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Do you remember anything more than my name?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Just that. But there’s something about the Glade...I was scared at first, but I should still _be curled ye in a corner weeping. Except, I eel...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Comfortable. (beat) Me too...Out in the Maze, it’s like I've seen it before. A moment, then THERESA beckons THOMAS closer to her...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Take a look at this... THOMAS moves around the table, next to THERESA where he c see her piles of maps laid out side-by-side.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So far I’ve only had time to study this one section. I realized on any given night, only a few of the 1s move...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: They know that. THERESA gives him an eye...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Right. But I don’t think they realize there’s a pattern.  57. Now, THOMAS is interested. THERESA picks up the first pil she’s assembled... THERESA (CONT’D) These are maps of a desert section, every’ 7th gay: They’re all slightly different, except for a few of the Walls which a ways return to the same position. THERESA compresses the pages together, and holds them up the light. The recurring walls are bolder than the rest.. Revealing a Runic symbol. THERESA registers THOMAS’ amazement...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I’m not sure. But all these years, the Maze has been speaking to them. Each section painting out some kind of message. THOMAS and THERESA stand close together, a charged moment taking in her discovery.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Amazing...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It shouldn't take long to find the other symbols.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: But what do we do with them? THOMAS and THERESA slowly look up from the maps and study each other. Then...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Catching up on old times? ALBY is in the doorway, along with MINHO. ALBY looks haggard, angry. MINHO, exhausted. An awkward beat of ilence, then...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: C’mon Thomas, we gotta brief the others... Off THOMAS’ look of confusion...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: After listening to Gally, at least half the Glade wanted you Banished. Forced out into the Maze alone tonight. Sacrificed to the Griever.  58.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Then I_told them about the cave and your plan to attack it. Now THOMAS is really freaked...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Min, you said yourself, even if we can draw them out, we have no idea--

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Save it. We’re out of options. ALBY stares at THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: I hope you find something. If you come up empty tomorrow, there’s nothing more I can do. You're finished. THERESA looks at THOMAS, who stands afraid, despondent. H pushes past ALBY and MINHO, out of the Map Room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .--and now sprints alone down the Homestead Path, running from the other Gladers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-finally colla sing to his knees at the edge of the Eas Fields, abandone quiet. He stares up at the strange sky, tears streaming down his face... His lips are still, but we PRELAP a BOY’S anguished cry of....

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Dad!ittit!! As we....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...PANDEMONIUM. PEOPLE stream out of every buildin along crowded city street, fighting to reach a black, ARM RED PERSONNEL CARRIER surrounded by rifle-wielding soldiers i HazMat combat suits. A loudspeaker blares...

dialogues.speaker: LOUDSPEAKER
dialogues.text: Step back or we will open fire! Only notified citizens will be granted entry!  59. The BOY is lost in the crowd. And then...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Son! The FATHER grabs his hand...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I told you not to let go! The BOY sighs, relieved. Suddenly the CARRIER fires up its engine and the SOLDIERS begin backing onto it as they push away the crowds.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cc’mon! The FATHER drags the BOY toward the vehicle, elbowing and shoving his way to the front. Finally they reach the CARRIER. halanx of SOLDIERS guards the entrance, rifles peady, where A e COMMANDER is usheri the last children on board!

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Please! We got our call... The COMMANDER holds up a RETINAL SCANNER to the BOY and t without a word, grabs him by the collar and rips him from FATHER’S grip, hauling him onto the CARRIER.

dialogues.speaker: BOY
dialogues.text: Wait!

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: (to the Father) Back away, sir.

dialogues.speaker: . FATHER
dialogues.text: He just wants to say goodbye! The CARRIER starts to roll forward, the BOY on board, par the CROWD. Still on the street, his FATHER, calls out...

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We'll see each other soon. I promise!! Looking down from the CARRIER, the BOY watches, helpless, the CROWD surges again, swallowing his FATHER. TIGHT ON the BOY’S anguished eyes, as the CARRIER door sw shut and we...

dialogues.speaker: FLASH BACK TO
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 60.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Thomas? THOMAS is still on his knees, staring at the sky, now sha off the vision. THERESA (CONT’D) Did you see something else? THOMAS nods, but he’s too disturbed to describe it. THERE kneels beside him. THERESA (CONT’D) Whether we like it or not, we’re in this together. THOMAS ; I know. I’m sorry. I just had to get out of there. They both sit a moment in silence.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Is there anything I can do...for tomorrow? THOMAS turns to her. Slowly, he reaches out and takes her hand. They both look at their fingers, intertwined. Then THOMAS looks in her eyes...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Tomorrow...the only thing that’s gonna help is a miracle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS and MINHO lead the other Runners -- ARON, JAYSON, TIM -- in formation through the Canyons, toward the Griev Hole. They stop at the narrow bottleneck, beyond which is the o Cavern. MINHO looks each Runner in the eye, one-by-one.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: See you back in the Glade, gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINHO emerges alone from the bottleneck and slowly approa the open Cavern, until...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 61. The first GRIEVER slithers out into the light. MINHO stop The second GRIEVER joins it. MINHO holds his ground. The GRIEVERS sit, pulsing, studying him. Then...the first GRIEVER‘Ss stinger slowly extends toward MINHO, the barbe glistening in the light.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Now! puddenty he steps aside. ARON, JAYSON, and TIM emerge beh him with cross-bows, firing a barrage Of arrows...THWAP!

dialogues.speaker: THWAP
dialogues.text: The arrows rocket toward the GRIEVERS...and THUCK! THUCK! THUCK! embed in their gelatinous flesh. The GRIEVER'S SHRIEK in unison... then, giving the RUNNER head-start in their escape, the GRIEVERS begin _pulsing furiously as their bodies expel the arrows one-by-one, leaving them scattered in the dirt, soaked in slime. And then the creatures barrel forward...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINHO, ARON, JAYSON and TIM each dive out of the bottlene somersaulting to a standing position and resuming their sprint... On their tail...the two coiled GRIEVERS... rolling out of bottleneck like an avalanche of destruction... We PAN back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -+-through the bottleneck and then UP... to find THOMAS wedged high above, between the two Walls of the Canyon, a the Grievers roll by beneath him...As THOMAS drops hard t the floor below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -;-MINHO, leading the pack of RUNNERS, suddenly veers to right, disappearing into another passage that branches of As JAYSON, ARON and TIM pass it by, one GRIEVER break off follow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 62.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS approaches the Griever Cave, now quiet. He steps o the threshold into the shadows of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .»..-a dark, domed chamber. There’s a light glow at the v back, about twenty yards ahead, and THOMAS moves cautious toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS... MINHO, ARON, JAYSON, and TIM, now each on t own, racing through different corridors of the Canyons, GRIEVERS close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS has reached the back of the chamber and the openin the base of the wall. He kneels to look inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARON, alone, comes bounding out of the far left passage i the quiet alcove where the Canyons begin. TIM emerges from a different passage... Then, MINHO, who shouts...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Where’s Jay? .+-as ARON and TIM dive into the safety of the Tunnel tha leads back to the Maze. MINHO slides to_a stop, turning back to look for JAYSON, the pursuing GRIEVERS roll into the alcove behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS’ POV as he stares into an enormous underground cav the size of an airplane hanger... The ground is solid cement, but the sloping rock walls ar lattice-work of round openings all the way across the ceiling. This is a hive. And, at the far end of the cavern, too far to make out an det4ils...there’s a round STEEL DOOR. SPIN BACK AROUND... to THOMAS, taking it all in from abov focused on the distant DOOR, élated. Trying to get a clos look, he dips his head down...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 63. Triggering...a wailing SIREN. Now, all over the cavern walls, one-by-one the holes are lighting up with that familiar red glow. HUNDREDS of GRIE eyes. The hive has awakened...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two GRIEVERS in the alcove are now pushing forward as MINHO backs toward the Tunnel... When, finally, JAYSON sprints out of the central passage, nearly colliding into the GRIEVERS from behind. As he pulls up short, heaving...

dialogues.speaker: JAYSON
dialogues.text: Took a wrong turn. My bad. MINHO looks at JAYSON, separated from him and the Tunnel the GRIEVERS. JAYSON understands his predicament -- there’s no way for to get past the creatures.

dialogues.speaker: JAYSON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Much luck, boys. We had a good run, didn’t we? With that, the GRIEVER closest to JAYSON spins around and IMPALES him with its STINGER. MINHO watches JAYSON double-over, eyes wide, and collapse of view. The GRIEVERS then together surge toward MINHO, who now ho into the Tunnel, where ARON and TIM stand, ashen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS’ POV... bounding toward the alcove where he’1l fac the same scene as JAYSON... But, THOMAS stops just before emerging. He slips off his backpack and takes out a crossbow, which he aims at the canyon wall ten feet above. He fires...THWACK...and an arrow, attached to a long line of rope, embeds in the roc wa . THOMAS finds the end of the rope, and threads it through another arrow...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-which now rockets over the GRIEVERS and lands in the s just above the Tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 64. MINHO reaches out to make sure its secure... And, now THOMAS comes flying through the alcove, knees tu to his chest, as he rides the rope like a zip line ten fe above the ground... Letting go at the last second...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-and flying into the Tunnel, feet-first, as the GRIEVER SHRIEK in fury. THOMAS, on his back, looks around and clocks MINHO, ARON, TIM. He now knows JAYSON didn’t make it. MINHO extends a hand to help him up. THOMAS hesitates...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I think I did something.

dialogues.speaker: PRELAP... SLAM
dialogues.text: INT. STUDY - ALBY’S DWELLING - LATER »-- aS ALBY Rounds his fist on the table, his frustration exploding. INHO and THOMAS, exhausted and demoralized, ha their heads. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: We should have stayed focused. Kept pressing ahead in the Grasslands. “Now, who knows what you triggered? THOMAS looks to MINHO, grasping for straws...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I still say we figure out a way to get down there... But MINHO’s out of patience...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Even if we could get past all those creatures, you said the door is solid steel. It’s a dead end, just like all the others.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The familiar East Gate to the Maze. Two RUNNERS, ARON and TIM stand watch in the clearing as the last light in the fades. NIGHT.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 65. But no bolts extend from the Walls. They remain still. Th Gate...OPEN. In the eerie quiet, ARON and TIM share a loo of absolute terror. INT. STUDY - ALBY’S DWELLING THOMAS faces ALBY and MINHO, his confidence shattered.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry guys. I really thought we were onto something. Before either of them can answer, they’re interrupted by growing din of a crowd outside... ALBY approaches the window, THOMAS and MINHO close behind him... EXT. ALBY’S CLEARING - THE GLADE - NIGHT ALBY, THOMAS, and MINHO look down into the clearing where most of the GLADERS have gathered. At the front of the mob is GALLY.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: The Walls didn’t close, Alby. Whatever Thomas did out there, the Maze and the Glade are one now. ALBY absorbs the news.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Soon the Grievers will be here. Weeks have become days. For some of us, only hours. ALBY tries to project command of the situation...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Listen to me! All of you! We’1l barricade the Homestead. Fight them off from the trees... The GLADERS are silent, terrified, already defeated. THOMAS spots CHUCK in the crowd, his face streaked with tears, pale white.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: I warned you not to provoke them! Now they'll kill every last one of us! ALBY scans the hopeless crowd...  66.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: You want to lie down?! You’re Gladers! You’re men! If we must die, then die like men! No one will make eye contact. His exhortation falls total flat.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: You've delivered us all to the slaughter. ALBY makes one last bid to preserve his authority...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Have you all forgotten what I’ve done for you? You think I wanted this burden? I did it for you! Together, we’ve risen to every challenge! And we can rise to this one! But now, the final blow...He spots NEWT, standing with th crowd, right beside GALLY. As ALBY’s face registers his shock at the betrayal, NEWT looks up, remorseless...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: You're soft, Alby. That was always your roblem. eat) I don! t know who_to believe anymore, but if I’m going down tonight, I’m going down with my brothers. Then, from behind him, NEWT pulls THERESA -- disheveled, trembling -- and hands her over to GALLY. GALLY, now totally unhinged, drags her forward, pointing at THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: They must be cast out! I've begged you to listen! (beat ) But I’m done asking. THERESA looks up at THOMAS, terrified. A beat, as ALBY takes the measure of the crowd and realiz he’s lost them. He turns to THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: He’s right, you know. You've brought nothing but disaster.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 67. EXT. ALBY’S CLEARING - THE GLADE - MOMENTS LATER Led by GALLY, NEWT and a crew of BAGGERS hauls THOMAS and THERESA out of the clearing, through the shouting, heckli CROWD... CHUCK is running alongside them, shouting at NEWT...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You can’t do this!! Until one of the BAGGERS violently shoves him to the grou Then, THOMAS spots MINHO and the other RUNNERS heatedly arguing. MINHO is about to step forward into GALLY’S path, who bra himself for a confrontation. But THOMAS looks MINHO in the eye.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Don’t. The Glade needs you. Save as many of them as you can. MINHO reluctantly holds back, and the BAGGERS drag away THOMAS and THERESA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they approach the Pit...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (whispers ) . I won’t let anything happen...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Why are they doing this? We've y tried to help them... GALLY and the BAGGERS stop.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Just him. NEWT starts pushing THOMAS into the Pit...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Wait! ...tearing him away from THERESA. THOMAS screams...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where are you taking her?! .--as he disappears into the darkness.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINHO stands watch by the open West gate. He’s pacing wit plant and cross-bow strapped across his back. A lit torch anted in the ground, uminating the first few feet of the Maze. ee MINHO stops. The low rumble of what sounds like an oncomi train is approaching. PRELAP... a CLANGING BELL, as...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERESA sits on the edge of a cot, in a dark, windowless room, somewhere in the Glade. She stands, startled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS also hears it. He gets up from the tiny cot in his cell and strains to look down the empty hallway...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINHO, ARON, and TIM converge from all directions in the Homestead Clearing, which is totally abandoned. NEWT walks out of the trees to greet them...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Gally?

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Wanted to ride it out with his Boys. MINHO nods.

dialogues.speaker: NEWT, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Which Gate?

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: All of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: QUICK CUTS... Long lines of glistening GRIEVERS barrellin out of the Maze and into the Glade...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pure chaos as all the GLADERS crowd into a central cluste three large tree-houses, connected by elevated walkways.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 69. MINHO is the last to climb up, and NEWT pulls up the ladd after him. The BAGGERS and RUNNERS are spreading out along the walkw armed with a combination of spears, cross-bows, and clubs Mixed among them are ZACK and several FIELD HANDS, brandishing their tools as weapons. Even WINSTON the cook wielding a butcher’s knife. ALBY takes it all in, clearly sidelined, as CLINT approac struggling under the weight of a large Satchel. He Opens to reveal the CRYSTAL TUBES that contain the Serum.

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: What little that’s left... ALBY nods, then turns to look inside one of the tree- houses...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -Twenty of the youngest GLADERS, including CHUCK, are huddled in the crowded space. They look up at ALBY, sheer terror in their eyes. ALBY offers a half-hearted nod of assurance, and closes t loor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long line of GRIEVERS tears through the Eastern Fields, crushing stalks of wheat, uprooting tomato vines, and sen chunks of soil flying through the air in a maelstrom of destruction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINHO, NEWT, and ALBY are side-by-side, waiting. ALBY is resi ned, détached. NEWT, adjusting his weapons nervously MINH primed and ready. And then, the CRACK, SNAP, and BOOM of nearby trees being mowed down...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Let’s take a few of the bastards with us. .»+.as the GRIEVERS converge from every direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERESA backs away from the door of her tiny room as, somewhere outside, one of the creatures grows closer, louder...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 70.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the mass of GRIEVERS crowd the base of the tree cluste A panicked ATLAS turns to NEWT.

dialogues.speaker: ATLAS
dialogues.text: Now? But NEWT hesitates. MINHO steps forward...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Only when they start to climb! Aim for their eyes and their stomachs!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS has flipped over the cot in his cell and is bracin the frame against the wall, furiously trying to stomp it pieces. Then... A SHRIEK... from down the hall, and he stomps one more time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-followed by a chorus of SHRIEKS as the front line of GRIEVERS begins to climb the tree trunks.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Fire! THWACK! THWACK! THWACK! THUCK! THUCK! THUCK! The GRIEVERS absorb the arrows and...pause. Then they begin to pulse, as the arrows are pushed back t the surface of their skin. As_ the last arrow is disgorged and drops to the forest f below, the creatures continue moving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERESA is crouched in the farthest corner from the door outside a series of... SHRIEKS... followed by guttural human CRIES...echo... With each CRY she shudders, finally trembling, and no lon able to contain her fear... PRELAP...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Help me!!!  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As THOMAS freezes in place. He’s nearly broken off the longest piece of the cot’s frame, but now stands still. He takes a breath, tries to focus...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Theresa, you’re doing it again...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERESA’S face freezes in shock. She’s heard him. She concentrates...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Thomas?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: It’s me...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: How can I hear you?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: This is what I was talking about! It’s some kind of telepathy! Where did they take you?

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I don’t know... There was a dead tree --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her voice trails off in THOMAS’ head...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Theresa??? Now frantic..

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hurry! THOMAS turns back to the cot and delivers one last devastating kick, finally shattering it. THOMAS picks up the longest piece of the cot’s frame, a l wooden rod, just as... A GRIEVER slithers in front of the cell, facing him. THOMAS is inches from the beast, and for a moment, they simply stare at each other. Then... The GRIEVER lunges forward, breaking through the bars of cell, and sending THOMAS slamming into the wall behind hi  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 72. The GRIEVER’S mouth opens...and SNAP...its STINGER shoots forward, which THOMAS deflects with the rod, sending it i the rock wall, inches from his body. The GRIEVER quickly tries to retract the STINGER, but it won't budge, the barbed tip stuck in place. THOMAS spins off the wall, raises the rod above his head, brings it down ina crushing blow, which SNAPS the STINGER right in the middle... As the GRIEVER lets out a ROAR of agony, THOMAS sprints b it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tree cluster is now covered in climbing GRIEVERS, sev nearly level with the walkways... MINHO races to where the first GRIEVER is about to overta BAGGER, who's clubbing it to no avail... MINHO arrives Just as the GRIEVER’S STINGER rockets up, stabbing the BAGGER right through the forehead... As the BAGGER collapses, the GRIEVER pulls itself up onto walkway, exposing it’s belly for a split second... Which MINHO ferociously IMPALES with his spear. He drops shoulder and lunges forward, sending the GRIEVER flying.. MINHO watches in pappy disbelief as the GRIEVER crashes t the forest floor below. He looks to his left, and sees... NEWT has witnessed the move...and quickly repeats it...sending another GRIEVER hurling to the ground... MINHO looks to his right and sees... ADBY completely still amidst the madness, his expression lan! Then, that awful RUMBLE again, and the GRIEVERS below par let through... A barreling onslaught of rolling GRIEVERS, which collide the base of the trees, sending splinters o£ wood explodin into the air... The walkways heave...and a BAGGER loses his footing, plummeting into the seething creatures below. Then, the next GRIEVER impacts, and the tree sways... EXT. GALLY’S GROVE THOMAS races across the field toward Gally’s Grove...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 73. The overturned tree’s massive tangle of roots has been obliterated -- a round tunnel carved right through it, exactly the shape of a rolling GRIEVER... THOMAS slows slightly, then bounds through it... EXT. GALLY’S CLEARING ...emerging into GALLY’S clearing, where... The barricades are all overturned, and the shelter lies i heap of rubble. Several bodies -- dressed in the rags of CHANGED BOYS -- are scattered amidst the wreckage. But no sign of THERESA. Then, from the trees to his right... a SHRIEK. THOMAS spo a barely visible path and takes off toward it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: py gronning past the bodies of three more CHANGED BOYS, l flat on their stomachs, mowed down from behind. Suddenly SOMETHING dashes out of the trees cutting him of It’s one of the SHEEP from the GLADE’S small herd, which BLEATS, before disappearing... Ahead, THOMAS can see the Stables...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: «+-a long building with a central hallway lined with padd for the various animals. THOMAS enters. Down the hall to his left, he hears moveme in the darkness. He sprints right, past empty paddocks un spotting a fully enclosed room in the back corner. He opens his mouth to shout, when, from inside the room..

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Thomas! THERESA leaps up just as... THOMAS bursts through the door. THERESA embraces him. A beat, then... SHRIEK!... and THOMAS grabs her hand...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Let’s get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The central tree cluster buckles one last time under the relentless assault of the GRIEVERS and slowly begins to topple...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The huddled GLADERS are all thrown to one side of the roo CHUCK in the middle of the pile, as the floor tips and th entire structure...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++.goes crashing to the ground, sending the GRIEVERS scattering. All is still for a moment, then... FOCUS ON...CHUCK, bleeding badly from his head, trying desperately to lift a piece of wood that has him pinned own... Nearby, CLINT, dazed, is scrambling to collect the CRYSTA TUBES, several of which have fallen out of his satchel... BACK TO.. CHUCK, who gives the wood plank one last push, it doesn’ t budge, and he closes his eyes, fading into oblivion. Then...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Get up! MINHO, lifting the debris, is standing over him, watching several nearby GRIEVERS now slowly retreating back throug the forest... Across the clearing... ALBY stands frozen amidst the mayhem. Fallen torches have ignited brush fires all around him, and he stares off int t e@ near distance where the Cook Shed and tables are als burning... Then, ALBY turns and sees MINHO. They lock eyes, and MINH calls out to him...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alby!!! But ALBY’S face makes it clear he’s already surrendered. ignores MINHO and walks toward the fires.  75. MINHO watches his old friend disappear and takes off with CHUCK toward safety...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS and THERESA race back down the Stable’s central Hallway. They are about to run out the exit when, from the opposit end of the building...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: No!!! -.-followed by another SHRIEK,..and, then BOOM!...a paddo door is blown clear off its hinges. THOMAS and THERESA pause. THOMAS thinks, then pulls THERESA’s arm to continue moving. She stands firm.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: He wants us dead! THERESA still doesn’t move. Off her look...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Fine! But you stay here. She ignores that also... THOMAS moves down the dark Hallway, THERESA a few steps behind him, until they can_see the GRIEVER slowing forcin GALLY back against the wall. THOMAS looks around frantically, and picks up a three-pro HAY FORK lying on the ground. THOMAS stops ten feet behind the GRIEVER. GALLY now sees and stares in disbelief. why? GALLY ly? The GRIEVER spins to face THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’m not what you think I am! .--and starts inching toward him. THOMAS suddenly lunges and STABS the GRIEVER directly bet its S, glowing red eyes, embedding the HAY FORK deep in i The GRIEVER SHRIEKS in agony...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Cc’mon!  76. .--allowing GALLY to slide past it and regroup behind THO

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take the girl and get out of here! GALLY hesitates a moment, then looks at THERESA...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: I won’t harm you. GALLY and THERESA start moving more quickly toward the ex THERESA keeping an eye on THOMAS who’s backing away slowl trying to keep the GRIEVER’S attention. Suddenly, the GRIEVER swings the still-protruding handle the HAY FORK at THOMAS... catapulting him into the closes paddock. The GRIEVER turns into the paddock, bearing down on THOMA who's trapped, gasping for air, and struggling to stand. GRIEVER is about to pounce on him, when... SLAM!...THERESA pounds it with a shovel...drawing it away The GRIEVER turns, rolls up and barrels after her, as she sprints down the Hallway... Just as the GRIEVER is about to overtake THERESA, she suddenly leaps back-and-forth between the walls on either side, grabbing onto a rafter as the creature rumbles past beneath her... THOMAS emerges from the paddock in time to see THERESA complete an acrobatic flip off the ceiling beam, dropping the floor in a perfect landing. Off THOMAS’ look of disbelief, THERESA calmly stands up a together they race outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINHO and NEWT lead a dazed mob of two dozen GLADERS, CHU among them, tripping, stumbling, crawling... ...past the Map Room, completely flattened, tattered parchment floating through the air...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-finally spilling out of the trees, heading toward the ravaged Eastern Fields...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: We rest here. MINHO turns to CLINT...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 77. MINHO (CONT’D) Treat the stung, first. Then the others. CLINT nods. As he moves off into the crowd of walking wounded...

dialogues.speaker: CLINT, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Anyone need the Serum?! NEWT approaches MINHO...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Sitting ducks out here. They backed off for no reason, no telling when they’1l come back.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: We collect whatever water we can can from the aqueducts. Then, I don’t know... I guess we keep moving. Before NEWT can reply, THOMAS, THERESA, and GALLY emerge together -- from another section of trees. MINHO and NEWT stand, stunned, as the group walks toward them. THOMAS surveys the small battered group of remainin GLADERS...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: The others? By the look on MINHO’s face, THOMAS knows the answer. THOMAS turns back to the survivors...WINSTON is applyin pressure to another BOY’S bleeding leg, and ATLAS is help ashion a splint, while CLINT scurries among them. But there's no sign of ZACK, ARON, TIM and so many other fami aces.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Alby... MINHO shakes his head, his eyes glistening as the anguish overtakes him. THOMAS finally spots CHUCK sitting up, alone in the crowd His clothes are torn and he’s holding his sleeve to his o wounded head. THOMAS turns to THERESA...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That boy over there, by himself...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I see him. THERESA jogs over to CHUCK, kneeling beside him.  78. NEWT is now simmering, about to challenge THOMAS, but THO preempts him...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Gally was right. (beat She and I are different. We can do things I can’t explain. And before the Glade, we knew each other. GALLY says nothing. NEWT and MINHO are shocked...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: You have memories?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Just a glimpse of the world we came from... MINHO can’t believe this...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Nothing useful. Nothing that will help us get out of here. They continue staring at him, expectantly...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: There was ash falling from the sky. People were scared. And my father. He was sending me someplace... He trails off as the others absorb this. And then, NEWT snaps, gesturing at the carnage...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: You’re the only one who remembers a god damn thing, and you still want us to believe you had nothing to do with this? THOMAS sees THERESA is walking back toward them.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Just wait... Let us show you. (to Theresa) You have it? THERESA nods and hands over a sheet of paper which THOMAS unfolds. On the page is a sketch of the Maze -- a circle Theresa h divided into six wedges, like slices of a pie. Inside eac wedge is a Runic Symbol" Five are clear, complete, and on half-formed...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 79.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The Maze wasn’t moving to change up the routes. It was forming these ols. Theresa found them. The last one’s incomplete because the grassland maps aren’t finished... As MINHO, GALLY, and NEWT take it in...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We’re on your side. I don’t know how else to prove it. A beat, and then, matter-of-fact...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: You may be now. But there’s a reason you're different. I’m sure of it. Now it’s MINHO’s turn to snap, his frustration with GALLY boiling over...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: It’s always the same, isn’t it? (beat) Even if what you’re saying about him is true, what good is it? What the hell’s he supposed to do about it? GALLY’S calm, silent. And so is THOMAS. A long beat as he makes a decision.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (to Minho) I can go through the Changing. MINHO and THERESA look at THOMAS in disbelief...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: That’s insane --

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Thomas... But THOMAS cuts them off...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: If Gally’s right, it could bring back the rest of my memory. There’s a chance I’1l remember something we’ve all been missing. THERESA can’t believe what she’s hearing...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: And what if he’s wrong? Please, Thomas...You can’t do this.  80.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: What if you see nothing and wake up a zombie? Now, NEWT interjects...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: I say it’s the least he can do. And don’t care if it kills him. MINHO ignores him, focused on THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: I’m sorry I let them lock You UP, but you don’t have to do this! know who you are...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: So do I, Min. I’m a Glader. (beat) . A Maze Runner. And escape is all that matters. A beat, as THOMAS’ resolve sinks in. THERESA turns away f him. NEWT looks up at the sky which is beginning to lighten...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Where to? Can’t stick around here much longer.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: The Maze. More places to disappear if we need to. MINHO turns back to THOMAS... MINHO (CONT’D) You can’t just walk up to one, hoping it stings you...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I have an idea.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: And the hours of pain and torment...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Gally will help me through it. GALLY studies THOMAS and slowly nods. And, MINHO realizes there’s no more use arguing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS enters his old cell. He approaches the spot where GRIEVER’S STINGER was embedded in the rock wall and caref removes a still glistening needle.  81.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surviving GLADERS march through the Maze, THOMAS and MINHO in the lead. NEWT and ATLAS guard the rear, while THERESA and CLINT help along the most severely wounded. The GLADERS, inside the Maze for the first time, stare in at its massive Walls and endless corridors. Only GALLY, limping along, keeps his eyes down, blocking his surroundings...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They finally arrive at a large circular room in the Grasslands, with four passages leading off in the cardina directions. As THOMAS looks around...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Good chance they won’t find us here. At least, not for a while. If they do, we’ ve got options. The others spread out, finding soft spots on the mossy ground. THERESA approaches WINSTON...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Water now. I think most of them can hold out on food for another few hours. MINHO, still beside THOMAS, points to one of the passages

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: That’s a dead end. (beat) I don’t think the others should see- He trails off... THOMAS nods. MINHO takes one last look at him and turns t NEWT... MINHO (CONT’D) C'mon. Let’s work out a watch schedule. Now GALLY approaches...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: The process can take hours... THOMAS surveys the GLADERS, lingering on THERESA, who’s b passing a canteen.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Let’s get started.  82.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Walls of the Maze form a small, square room, where GA is driving the last of four spikes into the ground, at th corners of a blanket. Each spike is attached to a rope th will tie down THOMAS’ hands and ankles... A CRYSTAL TUBE of SERUM is laid out on a rag, alongside t Griever’s STINGER. THOMAS watches as GALLY finishes...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: What’s it like? Really... GALLY looks up at him.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: You're wondering if it’s worse than death (beat) Your own?’ Definitely. THOMAS turns away. Then...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But, worse than watching your friénds slaughtered? Men you've lived beside and cared for? I guess that depends on what kind of man you are. A beat as THOMAS absorbs GALLY’s words. Then...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: And, what if I’m not as strong as you? GALLY thinks, and for a moment, seems to soften.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Strength comes from purpose. eat) Alby knew that_better than anyone. It’s why we followed him. Loved him. At least why I did. Suddenly, THERESA emerges at the threshold of the room...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Can I have a minute? GALLY gives THOMAS one last look, his face pained and har again, before he exits. THERESA sees the spikes in the ground and, under her breath... THERESA (CONT’D) Looks cozy...  83. THOMAS is not sure what to say. THERESA (CONT’D) What are you hoping to see, exactly?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: A big ‘Exit’ sign too much to ask for? She doesn’t even smile.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Don’t do it Thomas. (beat) There’s no guarantee it’1l help, and you could lose your mind like the rest of them. Best case, you'll end up like Gally!

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I don’t know...The whole bitter lunatic vibe is growing on me. THERESA begins to tremble, and he realizes how upset she is... THOMAS (CONT’D) I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to--

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: We can hear each other’s thoughts Thomas! That means something! If you do this, we might never find out how, or why... THOMAS can’t bring himself to lie and reassure her. He lo at the ground...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I have to try. This is bigger than us. Those guys out there are counting on me. She steps closer. THOMAS looks up at her..

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: If I lose you, I’1ll lose the only real thing that’s left in me. From THERESA’S searching brown eyes we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those same eyes...on a thirteen-year-old girl, standing i the second-story window of that brick townhouse.  84. THERESA’S POV this time, Jooking out on the street below, where a young THOMAS stands amidst a gentle shower of whi snowflakes, staring back at her. THERESA presses her hand to the window, reaching out to h best friend, her soulmate, as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS, now directly in front of her, their faces inches apart. His lips don’t move...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What did you see? And neither do her's...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tom... I saw you. And they KISS, with the combined passion of both the firs and what-could-be the last time.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I feel like I was sent here for a reason. To stop you from doing this... For a beat, it looks like THOMAS might cave. But then...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I lost you once before and still managed to find you. Here, in the worst place imaginable. I'’11 find you again. I promise. THERESA backs away, devastated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS is on his back, tied to the stakes, a piece of woo between his teeth to bite down on. GALLY slowly slides the Griever stinger into the soft sid THOMAS’ elbow, holding the needle in his flesh as the bla venom courses into him, darkening his veins as it spreads As THOMAS’ teeth clench, he throws his head to one side, spitting out the wood in agony. GALLY raises the molten, yellow Serum to his lips and THO devours it. GALLY lays down the empty CRYSTAL TUBE. THOMAS turns to i and for the first time, can clearly see his own reflectio  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 85. A beat as THOMAS stares at his own face, then... THOMAS’ entire body spasms like he’s being electrocuted. pupils suddenly blow, overtaking the whites of his eyes a We...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ++.a cavernous hanger filled with bunk beds, stacked thre high, row after row, a seemingly endless warehouse of...SLEEPING CHILDREN. We arrive at THOMAS, filthy and gaunt. - .who bolts uprig a flashlight shines "direct. y in his face...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Congratulations, Thomas. (beat) You've been Chosen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...THOMAS, now cleaned up and healthy, stares through a g partition at a thrashing GRIEVER bracketed to the floor o sterile white laboratory... A robotic arm swings into view, carrying one of the CRYST TUBES filled with the Serum. But this TUBE feeds a syring which is now inches from the creature’s flesh. The syring rimes itself...and a single drop of familiar yellow Fa id alls to the laboratory floor. The GRIEVER, frantic with fear, lets out a bloodcurdling SHRIEK, as that VOICE whispers...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Remember...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...the Hive, viewed from the other side of that steel doo Heavy cranes, steel beams, and other construction equipme sits idly in the eerie, cavernous space... From inside the Hive, a mechanized voice...

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER
dialogues.text: Locking Code Correct. eK  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 86. ...and the door SLAMS shut...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..-a MYSTERY POV moves through the familiar structures of Glade, but something is different. The shelters look less worn, the trees they hang in, younger. And scattered on the ground, as far as the eye can see, t are BODIES. We walk over the CORPSES, toward the only audible sound...a soft, plaintive whimpering. Finally, behind one of the largest trees, we find its sou THOMAS is cradling THERESA, who’s curled in the fetal osition. Their clothes are ripped, and they’re covered in lood.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: You failed. (beat) And now the others are dead. Every last one of them... THOMAS rocks back and forth...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’m sorry...I’m so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE
dialogues.text: Don’t be sorry, Thomas. Just get it right the next time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...THERESA and CHUCK, huddled beside each other, as THOMA lets out a tortured SCREAM that echoes throughout the Maz THERESA clenches her hands over her ears, burying her hea her lap, trying to drown out the sound of THOMAS’ agony a we... FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS’ POV...through a groggy haze: A gray sky. All arou stone Walls rising {mpossib y high.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 87. THOMAS slowly sits up, unsteady, as his vision slowly com into focus. He sees GALLY approaching with a canteen of water. THOMAS’ voice is dry, cracking...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: They'll keep sending us. They’11 keep killing more kids til we solve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GLADERS are all hunkered down, some sleeping, others leaning against the Walls, nervous, waiting. CHUCK is studying a cross-bow, awkwardly pretending to ai it. MINHO, NEWT, and ATLAS are each stationed at one of t entrances to the room. THERESA is seated by the passage to the dead end, keeping vigil for THOMAS. CHUCK lowers the crossbow, MINHO turns, and slowly everyo stares as... THOMAS steps into the circle, GALLY behind him. He bears mark of a terrible ordeal, his face more creased, like he aged half-a-decade. THERESA rushes to embrace him. But THOMAS stands stiff, unsure how to react, as THERESA wraps her arms around him She steps back...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Thomas? Are you okay? THOMAS looks in her eyes, but there’s no warmth in his expression.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’m fine. He’s all business. THERESA, hurt and confused, moves away while THOMAS scans the room for CLINT. THOMAS (CONT’D The Serum. How much is left of it? CLINT doesn't reply, still shocked THOMAS can speak.

dialogues.speaker: I --
dialogues.text: But THOMAS is single-minded... ; THOMAS ; Clint, we don’t have much time. It’s almost dark out there.  88. CLINT glances at the satchel of CRYSTAL TUBES on the grou next to him...

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: There were twenty tubes that rose with the first Box. After last night we were down to eight. I guess now seven...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: (disgusted) You wanna get stung again? This is ridiculous... THOMAS turns to NEWT.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: The Serum counteracts the Griever venom. It heals us. At least, that’s how this group chose to use it. (beat) But that’s not all it does... MINHO’s beginning to understand...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: It counteracts the Griever venom... THOMAS looks at him...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: For us, it’s medicine. For them, it’s poison. MINHO considers this...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Even if we can kill some of them, that only keeps us alive a few days longer...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: We have to fight our way into the Hive. The symbols are an access code...the combination to open that door. (beat We have five of the six. We’ll have to get lucky on the last one... MINHO digests the difficulty of what THOMAS is proposing. ATLAS doesn’t like one word of it...

dialogues.speaker: ATLA
dialogues.text: Why should we believe you? You could be leading us into a trap! Making it easier for them to finish us! THOMAS is about to answer when GALLY steps forward.  89.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Whoever Thomas once was, today he saw the path to salvation. So, let’s not waste it. THOMAS turns to MINHO...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: We can dip the spears and arrows, but there’s only enough Serum to arm a few of us. MINHO nods, then turns to GALLY...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: You and Atlas hole up someplace safe with the group. Thomas, Newt and I will assault the Hive, try to buy enough time to enter the code somehow. GALLY nods.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: When the door opens, we’ll come back for everyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the last light fades from the sky, CLINT pours a TUBE Serum into a bucket, as MINHO and NEWT carefully dip arro laying them out to ary. CLINT reaches back into the satchel for another TUBE, but finds it’s empty...

dialogues.speaker: CLINT
dialogues.text: There should be one more...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Must have gotten lost at the Homestead... GALLY wanders among the other _GLADERS, hel ing them stra packs of water and other supplies. Even A’ A goes from bo to boy, offering words of encouragement. CHUCK cautiously approaches THOMAS, who stands off to the side, in quiet contemplation...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Thomas? THOMAS is forced, curt...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Hi, Chuck.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 90.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: You think we might really be going home? THOMAS nods, still distant...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: We're close. That I’m sure of.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: I just really hope my parents remember me. THOMAS seems unsure what to do with the emotion. He looks CHUCK like he’s trying to recall what empathy feels like.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Whatever happens tonight, just be careful. CHUCK looks up at THOMAS waiting for more words of encouragement. But he’s met only with awkward silence. THOMAS walks away, now approaching THERESA, who’s helping WINSTON pack up the last of the rations. She stands to greet him...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Now you want to talk to me? THOMAS is flat, matter-of-fact...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: There’s something you need to know. Reluctantly, THERESA follows him...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...into a corner where they can be alone. She stares at h hurt and silent. THOMAS takes a breath and confesses...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You and I...We were here before. With another group of kids. And because of us, those kids are dead now. She gasps, absorbing the blow...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The people who built the Maze...They selected us. Separated us from the others and gave us...special skills. We were too young to understand anything. We must have thought it was a game.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 91. THERESA looks like she’s going to be ill. But THOMAS show no compassion. THOMAS (CONT’D) We have a chance to get it right now. But I need you to focus. A long beat as THERESA remains silent, reeling. Then...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: You don’t feel anything for me anymore, do you?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I don’t know Theresa. I just feel * different. * THERESA absorbs this.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I hope you’re right about * everything. I hope it was worth * it. But, before she can walk away, THOMAS reaches out for her

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: there i abomething else, Theresa. getting *Edrough that Hive. It’s just the beginning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS, MINHO, and NEWT armed with poison-tipped cross-bo and spears, are perched at the portal to the GRIEVER corridor, the rumbling sound of the passing creatures disappearing down the ramp and out into the Maze...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Figure twenty minutes before they realize the Glade’s empty, turn back, and start hunting. THOMAS nods his agreement. He looks down the mound of boulders to the ground below, where THERESA, ATLAS and th remainder of the GLADERS are crowded together, hidden amo the rocks. When THOMAS looks back up, MINHO’s taken off his armband.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Lead Maze Runner’s always worn it. Before he can object, MINHO grabs THOMAS’ arm and slides on.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 92. For a beat THOMAS studies the band, absorbing both the ho and the responsibility. Then, he looks back to MINHO... MINHO (CONT’D) I’m right behind you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS, MINHO, and NEWT walk slowly toward the now famili opening to the Griever Hive cavern. But as they approach, 1 is quiet. MINHO and THOMAS trade looks.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Where’s the welcoming committee? They keep moving...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...-into the entrance chamber, which is also empty. THOMA gestures toward the back and the Hive itself. The three crowd around the opening and look inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...where two dozen GRIEVERS pulsate throughout the cavern space. Most are clustered at the far end, near the steel door. NEWT looks at THOMAS.

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Don’t worry. If you’ re wrong about this, Grievers won’t get you. 1/11 kill you myself. THOMAS begins uncoiling a rope...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: GALLY and ATLAS stand watch, while THERESA huddles quietl with the other GLADERS, tense, waiting... Suddenly, a massive RUMBLING approaches...the sound of do of GRIEVERS racing toward them... THERESA stands up...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I thought we had more time... .»..as GALLY turns back to the group...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: They’ve found us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NEWT slowly lowers THOMAS into the chamber, while MINHO stands alert, cross-bow at the ready... THOMAS drops off the rope on the hard floor. Several of t closest GRIEVERS spin to face him... The nearest GRIEVER is about twenty feet away and now fas approaching. From above...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: You want me to take him?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: No. I wanna do this up close. The GRIEVER slithers forward.

dialogues.speaker: FASTER
dialogues.text: GALLY pushes frantically through a corridor of grass stal as every other step...

dialogues.speaker: SNAP
dialogues.text: ..-he uses his SPEAR to trigger a THORN TRAP. Behind him THERESA and ATLAS do their best to herd along GLADERS. As they send along the last of the stragglers...

dialogues.speaker: SHRIEK
dialogues.text: THERESA and ATLAS look back to see...the GRASS behind the parting... And the GRIEVERS rolling toward them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS, aiming his cross-bow, stares down the GRIEVER, no ten feet away. He shouts up to MINHO and NEWT...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You_ever notice? These things smell awful... -..and fires...THWAP! THUCK! The Serum-soaked arrow embeds in the GRIEVER’S fle The GRIEVER stops moving and SHRIEKS...then begins slowly pulsing, and...expels the arrow, which falls to the floor  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 94,

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Great... THOMAS can’t believe it. He starts back pedaling as the GRIEVER continues at him...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (panicked) No... And then...the GRIEVER once again STOPS. Its mouth opens wide, and its STINGER shoots forward, stopping inches fro THOMAS’ face. For a brief moment, THOMAS stares directly past the needl into the GRIEVER'S glowing red eyes. And, then, its gelatinous peae begins sinking into the fl dissolving into a bubbling dle of tar-like slime, its solid STINGER finally crashing to the ground, a harmless piece of debris. A long beat as THOMAS, MINHO, and NEWT stare in disbelief the first dead GRIEVER they’ve ever seen. Then, one-by-one, every other GRIEVER in the cavern turns face THOMAS and what’s left of their fallen comrade.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Looks like we got their attention.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The fleeing GLADERS now emerge into a bare Stone Corridor and GALLY pulls up short...at the edge of BREAKAWAY secti From the rear...

dialogues.speaker: ATLAS
dialogues.text: Why are you stopping? GALLY looks down the corridor and sees a CHECKERBOARD of patches, all the way to the end of it. THERESA comes up eside him...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: What’s the problem? GALLY stomps on the closest BREAKAWAY and it falls into t abyss. THERESA stares horrified. THERESA (CONT’D) There has to be another way... GALLY thinks a beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Send the word back -- everyone follow my footsteps exactly!!  95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS stands facing the horde of GRIEVERS, MINHO and NEW now beside him. The creatures have crowded together, but otherwise are still, seemingly passive...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: You think they want to surrender? But, with that, the entire hive begins to slowly vibrate, one-by-one, each GRIEVER seems to BLEND INTO the creature next to it, forming one growing MASS...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Uh. Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Most of the GLADERS have reached the end of the minefield but CHUCK is at the back of the pack, still navigating th BREAKAWAYS, drenched in flop sweat. CHUCK takes a step and STUMBLES, his foot falling through floor, his entire body lurching’ toward the darkness. But THERESA grabs his arm and pulls him to safety. As they take the last few steps to solid ground, they loo back to see...the first in the line of GRIEVERS, barrelin into the corridor and then...DROPPING through a BREAKAWAY into the darkness. The other GRIEVERS halt. THERESA turns to GALLY...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Did we stop them? In_ response, the next GRIEVER just climbs up the vertica wall and, parallel to the ground, begins slithering towar them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS, MINHO and NEWT cower, as the HIVE GRIEVERS have combined into a enormous, teeming, SWARM, towering above them. And then...the SWARM slowly begins to take FORM... Morphing into razor-sharp CLAWS. A NEEDLE-covered torso. swinging TAIL coated in still more poisonous STINGERS... -.-until a massive SCORPION-like creature now stands betw them and the doorway. A QUEEN GRIEVER.

dialogues.speaker: HOMAS
dialogues.text: These things are full of surprises.  96. MINHO runs forward, raising his crossbow...and THWAP!...f an arrow into the creature’s side. The QUEEN takes a wild swing with its CLAW, sending MINHO diving to avoid it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The GLADERS race through the Boulder Room, dodging the FLAMEBURSTS that erupt every few feet around them... ...-finally arriving beneath the portal. GALLY shouts to ATLAS...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: How much time do we have? .»»-as he begins ushering the GLADERS up the boulder pile ATLAS hops on a rock to play lookout, but he’s hardly got balance when...a GRIEVER collides with him, and he goes ying... ATLAS falls hard on the burnt ground, dropping his spear, the GRIEVER lands feet from THERESA. But before the creature can attack...ATLAS rolls over and fires his cross-bow... THWAP! THWAP! THWAP! and the GRIEV dissolves before them. As ATLAS struggles to reload his bow, two MORE GRIEVERS c slithering toward them... Then, THERESA spots ATLAS’ spear laying in the dirt. She picks it_up, and charges forward, swinging it wide like a sword, slicing through both the GRIEVERS.. As the creatures melt, THERESA runs past ATLAS to the bou pile and starts climbing up behind the last of the GLADER THERESA looks back to make sure ATLAS is following, in ti to see... Another GRIEVER launching itself from on top of the rock. ATLAS tosses THERESA his quiver of remaining arrows, as t GRIEVER lands on top of him, ripping him to pieces.

dialogues.speaker: THWAP
dialogues.text: THOMAS, MINHO, and NEWT are now spread out around the cav floor...taking turns firing at the QUEEN from different directions... THOMAS shouts...  97.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Not sure we can kill it!

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Maybe not! But we can try to distract it! THWAP! MINHO lets off another arrow...and the QUEEN once again lunges after him... THOMAS eyes the steel door. There’s narrow lane past the QUEEN through which he might be able to reach the exit... _., NEWT . . . You waiting for an invitation?! THOMAS bolts...as THWAP! THWAP! MINHO and NEWT unleash a storm of arrows... THOMAS is almost past the QUEEN, when it realizes what’s happening... The QUEEN swings its barbed TAIL in his direction... but THOMAS LEAPS over the hurtling mass of NEEDLES...and tumb to safety... As he peels himself up, he faces the ‘DOOR’ -- a massive steel plate embedded seamlessly in the rock before him.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THERESA drops off the rope into the Griever’s exit corrid where GALLY and the other GLADERS are waiting. GALLY gestures to the Tunnel entrance in the distance...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: They’re onto us. Might as well make our stand in the Hive with the others...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: But we don’t know how to get there... Then, a high-pitched WHINE from the opposite end of the corridor, as the floor opens up, spewing out a rolling GRIEVER. The GLADERS all race toward the Tunnel, GALLY helping ush them inside. As THERESA is about to climb through, she looks back in t to see... CHUCK has fallen. He’s alone, twenty feet back in the corridor, the GRIEVER bearing down...  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 98. THERESA’S about to run to his rescue, when GALLY grabs th poisoned spear in her hand..

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: I’ll go. THERESA hesitates.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I never believed I was going home. And I can buy you some time. (beat) You must show them the way.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: How? GALLY points to his head...

dialogues.speaker: GALLY
dialogues.text: Thomas can tell you. Before THERESA can answer, GALLY has the spear. He charge forward...slamming the weapon into the GRIEVER’S forehea just before it reaches CHUCK...... CHUCK struggles to his feet and races toward THERESA, who helps him into the Tunnel... She turns back to see GALLY watching the creature melt, a more GRIEVERS roll up from the ramp. GALLY looks back at THERESA one last time.

dialogues.speaker: GALLY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tell Thomas I was wrong about him. And I’m sorry. GALLY smiles -- euphoric -- and then marches toward the GRIEVERS and certain death

dialogues.speaker: BOOM
dialogues.text: The QUEEN slams its massive CLAW into the wall, as NEWT d to avoid it.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: I think it’s slowing down! We just need to get enough serum in it’ system...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Only two more arrows in my bow.  99.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: I’ve got three. (beat) Thomas? But THOMAS is focused entirely on the ‘DOOR.’ As he takes another step closer, the DOOR shimmers and it becomes one massive SCREEN -- a digital image of the Maze right in it center, surrounded by thirty Runic symbols... For a moment, THOMAS hesitates. And then an idea... He finds the first s ol THERESA decoded, and drags it ont the Maze image, exactly where it was revealed by the Maps The symbol glows xeon Vand stays in place.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Ok... THWAP! THWAP!...MINHO and NEWT each fire simlutaneously.. MINHO shouts to THOMAS, who’s now got three symbols in pl and hunting for the fourth...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Any luck?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Working as fast as I can...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Work faster...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: I’m out... The QUEEN lunges at NEWT, backing him into a corner... Then... THWAP! THWAP!...MINHO fires the last of his arrow drawing its attention... THOMAS steps back from the door, five symbols in place. H studies THERESA’S incomplete sketch of the last one. Then pooks back to the remaining choices around the perimeter the SCREEN. There’s at least three symbols that could match it. Close his eyes a beat. Picks one and drags it onto the Maze...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: C'mon... A beat, the symbol glows red and then... the whole screen resets. THOMAS explodes...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Damn it!!!  100. SLAMMING his fist into the still-closed door, then turnin find both MINHO and NEWT backing toward him, the QUEEN bearing down on all of them... THWAP!...THOMAS fires and, for a moment, the QUEEN slows, quickly recovers... THOMAS slings his empty bow over his shoulder. He, MINHO, and NEWT now have only their spears as The QUEEN surges forward... THOMAS runs at the QUEEN, wind-milling his spear to parry CLAWS... And then... THOMAS leaps into the air, stabs the center o the QUEEN’S torso, straight through, top-to-bottom, and pushes off the spear, vaulting over it... For a beat the QUEEN is pinned to the ground, but it buck furiously, rotating to face THOMAS. NEWT and MINHO try to engage, but, the QUEEN whips its TA in a fury, knocking their spears from their hands and sen the weapons scattering to a far corner... Now, THOMAS, NEWT, and MINHO all stand unarmed... Exhausted, ready to give up...

dialogues.speaker: _ MINHO
dialogues.text: Any more ideas?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: As a matter of fact...

dialogues.speaker: THUD
dialogues.text: A quiver of poison arrows lands at THOMAS’ feet. From above...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: I told you we were close. The QUEEN now makes a final charge at THOMAS, barrelling toward him... As he crouches, loads the arrows, and fires them off...

dialogues.speaker: THWAP
dialogues.text: ..-landing all three in its forehead. The QUEEN’S legs buckle and it barrels into the ground, inches from THOMAS, dissolving in a massive puddle. For a beat, all is quiet. Then THERESA slides down the ro THERESA (CONT’D) Let’s take another look at this door, shall we?  101.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINHO and NEWT divide up the remaining arrows from ATLAS’ old quiver, while CLINT and WINSTON hold the rope steady, the last of the GLADERS slide down into the Hive. THOMAS stands beside THERESA, entering the first five symbols, while she studies the KEYBOARD... When he’s ready for the last one... Without hesitation, THERESA points to one of the symbols. He looks at her...

dialogues.speaker: __ , THERESA
dialogues.text: I’m positive. He smiles, about to select it, when... VOICE (0.S. I should have banished you both from the start! THOMAS and THERESA turn to see... ALBY. He’s standing at the base of the rope, armed with a loade cross-bow. His clothes are torn, his hair almost complete white...

dialogues.speaker: _ THOMAS
dialogues.text: You're alive...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: And awake for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Are you hurt? ALBY now raises the cross-bow and aims it at THOMAS. The other GLADERS gasp..

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: He’s been Changed.

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: After I was stung in the Homestead, I was happy to die. But then I stumbled on some Serum in the wreckage. All those years listening to Gally rant and rave... Thought I’d get a taste. (beat) Turns out the mad man was_ right about everything after all... THOMAS is now holding up his hands defensively...  102.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Put down the bow, Alby. Whatever you think you saw, I can explain... But ALBY is maniacal...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: I built somethin here. Something extraordinary an they took it away!! All these years trying to escape...This is the escape fr out there! WINSTON and many of the GLADERS turn to THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: WINSTON
dialogues.text: What’s he talking about? Where are you taking us? ALBY faces the GLADERS...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: We can stay. We'll live in the Maze, fight the Grievers...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: It’s over Alby...

dialogues.speaker: ALBY
dialogues.text: Don’t believe him! He belongs in the Pit! He violated the Laws! Listen to me!!! ALBY starts to shake, then takes a breath and focuses the back on THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: Nol! And CHUCK dives in front of THOMAS, taking the arrow dire in his heart. THOMAS catches CHUCK, as...

dialogues.speaker: THWAP
dialogues.text: An arrow pierces ALBY in the gut, and he falls to the gro All the GLADERS’ turn to NEWT, who fired and took ALBY do A long beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Been listening for too long. Time to see, with our own eyes. THOMAS, cradles CHUCK, who looks up at him, life slipping away...  103.

dialogues.speaker: CHUCK
dialogues.text: If you find my mom and dad. Tell them I was the best Field Hand in the Glade. THOMAS’ hardened demeanor softens and we get a glimpse of boy he was before the Changing.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: I’1l tell them you were a hero, Chuck. Braver than all the Runners. Suddenly from above, a SHRIEK...and a GRIEVER drops into Cavern. Then ANOTHER... THERESA turns back to the door and drags the final symbol into place. All six symbols glow green on the image of th Maze. Then, the screen goes blank. And finally, it reads: “MAZE TRIAL: COMPLETE.” A beat, then the ground begins to SHAKE, and the steel do rises out of the rock, and rolls to the side, revealing a platform. THERESA steps inside and looks up.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: It’s an elevator! C’mon! The GLADERS hesitate half-a-beat, but with little choice, they pile inside, as MINHO and NEWT do their best to ward the GRIEVERS with the remaining arrows. As they back into the elevator... THERESA (CONT’D) Thomas!!! THOMAS looks to her, then one last time at CHUCK whose ey flutter close. He lays down the boy’s body and jumps on t elevator platform, just as it begins to rise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THOMAS, THERESA, NEWT, and the GLADERS stand silent, somb as the elevator slows to a stop before another steel door The door opens. And the GLADERS all stare in AWE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -+-at a sterile, white room, lit by overhead fluorescents and split in half by a glass partition. Behind the glass, massive wall of monitors stream aerial images of the now- empty Maze and Glade from every conceivable angle. And seated before those monitors, at an elaborate compute terminal are a dozen ADULTS in white lab coats.  Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 104. Everything about the setting is sleek, modern, in stark contrast to the natural materials of the Maze’ and Glade. As the GLADERS file out of the elevator and into the room several of the ADULTS turn around and approach the glass. For a beat, the GLADERS and the ADULTS simply stare at ea other. Then, one of the ADULTS, a kind-looking WOMAN presses a button on the terminal behind her, and an intercom is activated.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Welcome home. The GLADERS remain silent, stunned... WOMAN (CONT’D) Congratulations, Thomas! And to Fou all on_a wonderful achievement. he first Group to complete the Maze! And not post complete it...We never thought so many would survive! MINHO steps forward...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: What the hell is going on? Who are you people?

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Mr. Minho. Agile, strong, calm under crushing pressure. You should be very proud.

dialogues.speaker: NEWT
dialogues.text: Proud? Half our friends are dead...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: And, yet, even in the end, when we accelerated the stimuli, you kept going. You insisted on maintaining order, enforcing Laws. Mr. Minho and his Runners kept mapping a shifting Maze that couldn’t be solved. Every day, men did back- breaking work in the fields, labored to erect structures with few tools and meager supplies. And why?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Because they never gave up.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: That's right Thomas. Never stopped looking for a solution. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: And you! Viewed at first with contempt, then suspicion, but finally rising to their lead. Proving yourself willing to sacrifice everything in order to save your flock. eat) You are worthy of the task for which you've been groomed. MINHO looks at THOMAS, confused.

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: I don’t understand...who are these people? Now a BALD MAN steps up next to the WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: BALD MAN
dialogues.text: We are The Consortium. (beat) Humanity’s last hope. Behind the BALD MAN, the control-room monitors are no lon broadcasting the Glade. Instead, a different series of images: The sun exploding, turning the sky blood red. Ash andmark the ground like snow. Familiar city skylines and landmark laid ruin. Those armored personnel carriers. Men in biohazard suits stepping over corpses in the streets. BALD MAN (CONT’D) Since the Flare, the sickness has spread faster than anyone anticipated. There are hardly any sanctuaries left. What you’re doing here is critical. “The Chosen and their followers will save mankind. The WOMAN shoots the BALD MAN a silencing look. She turns back to the GLADERS...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: We know how jarring this must be. But you’re safe now. And you’ll need your rest. The Maze Trial was post the beginning. Phase Two egins soon. MINHO turns again to THOMAS...

dialogues.speaker: MINHO
dialogues.text: Phase two? I thought we were free...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Not now, Thomas. You’1l have lenty of time to rally your troops or the challenge ahead. This is a moment to rest and regroup. To enjoy. Suddenly, a door to their right opens, and a crew of ARME CONSORTIUM OFFICERS file in.

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: These officers will show you to your quarters for the night. Then... WOMAN (CONT’D) Thomas. Theresa. You may come with us. THOMAS and THERESA don’t move, as the others stare in disbelief. THOMAS turns to MINHO and NEWT.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: (whispers ) I know what it looks like. But this isn’t over yet. The WOMAN presses a button and a door opens in the glass partition. THOMAS looks at THERESA and together they walk forward an step inside. As they watch the CONSORTIUM OFFICERS begin rounding up the GLADERS...

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You sure about this?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: THERESA, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What if it’s worse out there, alone?

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We’re not alone. Suddenly, THOMAS and THERESA, reach into their waistbands paid out serrated BLADES. They grab the BALD MAN and the OMAN, holding the knives to their throats... The armed CONSORTIUM OFFICERS all turn, but they’re separ by the glass. THOMAS barks to one of the adult TECHNICIANS still seated the computer terminal...  107.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: Bring up the profiles!

dialogues.speaker: TECHNICIAN

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Start with Minho. The TECHNICIAN hits a few buttons and the monitors all broadcast one giant image of... MINHO, no more than eleven years old, atop a smiling man’ shoulders, standing by the Golden Gate Bridge. Next to th is a beautiful woman cradling an infant gir THOMAS looks out through the glass at MINHO. Over the intercom...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're from San Francisco, Min. You had a mother and fathér. A baby sister named Kim. MINHO can’t take his eyes off the photo, and for the firs time, we see tears stream down his face. The monitor ghanges and now it’s a young NEWT, on a farm, kneeling amidst half-a-dozen oung ids; a stern older man looking on, arm around his wife’s waste. THOMAS (CONT’D) Newt, you were born in Oklahoma. Oldest of six. NEWT’s hardened facade crumbles. As the GLADERS stand silent, the monitors cycle through a short montage of FAM PHOTOS, concluding with... THOMAS. His FATHER’S arm around him, center-field at Yank Stadium. THOMAS looks up, focusing on his dad...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s my father. My best friend. I don’t know if he, or anyone else is still alive out there. But I intend to find out. THOMAS locks eyes with MINHO...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You once told me... Never stop mov" beat ) (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue (mm/dd/yyyy) 108.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know we’re all tired. But if we want to really be free, we need to keep running. (beat) We survived the Maze. We defeated the Grievers. And I don’t know about you, but I’m done being a pawn in someone else’s game. (beat) We can do this, Min. Together, we can do anything. MINHO looks around at the CONSORTIUM OFFICERS who stand, unsure what to do. At the exhausted GLADERS. And back at THOMAS. He nods. THOMAS gives the TECHNICIAN one last order...

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Unlock the access doors to the street. Now the WOMAN shouts...

dialogues.speaker: WOMAN
dialogues.text: Don’t do it! We’ve invested too much! THOMAS pushes so hard he draws a drop of blood from the B MAN'S neck. He glares at the WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: THOMAS
dialogues.text: You wanted to see how we’d handle your puzzle? This is our solution. (beat) I said let us out.
